original: @1b # // rnam dag rigs pa bla med sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: @1b # // rnam dag rigs pa bla med sna tshogs pa //
translated: The supreme, various reasoning of the pure

original: rang don gnas skabs gnod med bshad nas ni //
analyzed: rang don gnas skabs gnod med bshad nas ni //
translated: is explained as not harmful to the temporary states of one's own aim.üîΩThe supreme temporary states of the performance of others' aims

original: de yi gzhan gyi don byed gnas skabs mchog / skye bo kun las phul byung brjod par bya //
analyzed: de yi gzhan gyi don byed gnas skabs mchog / skye bo kun las phul byung brjod par bya //
translated: are expressed as the most excellent of all beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas skabs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas skabs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Bhagavat's states are of four kinds.

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i gnas skabs bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i dbye bas gnyis dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i gnas skabs bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i dbye bas gnyis dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the causal state is twofold, by the divisions of intention and application, and the resultant state is also twofold, by the divisions of the perfection of one's own and others' aims.

original: de ston par byed pa'i le'u yang rnam pa bzhi kho na'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i le'u yang rnam pa bzhi kho na'o //
translated: The chapters that teach those are also of four kinds.

original: de la slob dpon gyis brtsams pa'i 'jug pa 'di las le'u gnyis kyi rgyan mdzad nas ;
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyis brtsams pa'i 'jug pa 'di las le'u gnyis kyi rgyan mdzad nas ;
translated: There, the master having composed the introduction to this treatise, and having made the ornaments of two chapters,

original: le'u tha ma'i rgyan la de kho na ltar bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ni rang gi don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: le'u tha ma'i rgyan la de kho na ltar bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ni rang gi don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: in order to make the ornament of the final chapter just like that, he says one's own aim and so on.

original: 'on te grangs can bzhin du rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa med bzhin du gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa brjod dam snyam du dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa /
analyzed: 'on te grangs can bzhin du rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa med bzhin du gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa brjod dam snyam du dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa /
translated: Having anticipated this qualm, he says:

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa shin tu nges par byas pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa shin tu nges par byas pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags te /
translated: The method of ascertaining an inference for oneself is a reason having the three modes.

original: de rgyu yin pa'i phyir /üîΩde las skyes pa lkog tu gyur pa'i @2a * //
analyzed: de rgyu yin pa'i phyir / de las skyes pa lkog tu gyur pa'i @2a * //
translated: Because that is the cause.üîΩThe cognition of that which is hidden

original: shes pa de'i de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: shes pa de'i de ma thag tu'o //
translated: arises from that immediately.

original: de med par ni tshul gsum ba'i rtags brjod pa'i bdag nyid gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su bag pa mi brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de med par ni tshul gsum ba'i rtags brjod pa'i bdag nyid gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su bag pa mi brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Without that, an inference for others, which has the nature of stating a reason having the three modes, is not stated. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ga las shen /
analyzed: 'di ga las shen /
translated: Why is this?

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is preceded by an inference for oneself.‚Äù

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin na ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag ba ra mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin na ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag ba ra mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is not preceded by that, it is illogical for an inference for others to occur. This is the meaning.

original: des na grangs can gyis brtags pa'i tshul gsum pa 'chad ba na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na grangs can gyis brtags pa'i tshul gsum pa 'chad ba na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the three modes of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs reasoning are stated, it is not an inference for the sake of others.

original: 'dir ni 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: Here, this is what is being thought:

original: ci ltar rjes su dpag pa gnang de'i rgyu'i 'bras bu tshig la rjes su dpag par brjod pa de ltar /
analyzed: ci ltar rjes su dpag pa gnang de'i rgyu'i 'bras bu tshig la rjes su dpag par brjod pa de ltar /
translated: Just as an inference is accepted, and its cause-effect relationship is stated in the statement ‚Äúinference,‚Äù

original: de mngon sum dang de'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te des na mngon sum du ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de mngon sum dang de'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te des na mngon sum du ni mi brjod do //
translated: in the same way, direct perception is not that, nor is it the cause-effect relationship of that, so it is not stated as direct perception.

original: tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pas kyang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pas kyang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
translated: Since the words are the cause of inference, they are an inference for the sake of others.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not direct perception for the sake of others,

original: de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de ma thag tu ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de ma thag tu ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are not the cause of that, as will be shown immediately below.

original: rnam rtog ming gi rten yin pa dang 'bras bu yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rnam rtog ming gi rten yin pa dang 'bras bu yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is because of the mode of being a basis for conceptual thought and a name, and being a result.

original: des na 'di ni ri dags rgyugs pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum du ji ltar brjod /
analyzed: des na 'di ni ri dags rgyugs pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum du ji ltar brjod /
translated: Therefore, how could it be said that this is a direct perception of the meaning of another word, such as ‚Äúdeer‚Äù?

original: gal te yang 'dir @2b 'di'i go rims brjod par bzhed pa yin na de'i tshe 'di skad ces rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag ba brjod nas /
analyzed: gal te yang 'dir @2b 'di'i go rims brjod par bzhed pa yin na de'i tshe 'di skad ces rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag ba brjod nas /
translated: If it is the order of the words that is intended here, then it should be stated, ‚ÄúHaving stated the inference for oneself,

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes dpag brjod do zhes gsung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes dpag brjod do zhes gsung par 'gyur te /
translated: one should state the inference for another.‚Äù

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like the statement, ‚ÄúHaving stated the general definition, the specific definition is explained.‚Äù

original: go rims brjod na ni gtan tshigs 'god par yang mi rigs te snga ma nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims brjod na ni gtan tshigs 'god par yang mi rigs te snga ma nyid bzhin no //
translated: If the order of the words is stated, it is not logical to state the reason, just as before.

original: 'on te der ni rtogs par sla ba'i phyir ma bkod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der ni rtogs par sla ba'i phyir ma bkod do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that in that case it is not stated because it is easy to understand,

original: 'on 'dir yang de bzhin du 'gyur bas gtan tshigs dgod pas ci bya /
analyzed: 'on 'dir yang de bzhin du 'gyur bas gtan tshigs dgod pas ci bya /
translated: then since it would be the same here, what is the use of stating the reason?

original: go rims ni thams cad dang mi 'gal bar bstan zin pa khon te /
analyzed: go rims ni thams cad dang mi 'gal bar bstan zin pa khon te /
translated: The order of the words has already been explained without contradicting any of the others.

original: des na skabs dang rjes su mthun par bshad pa snga ma nyid legs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na skabs dang rjes su mthun par bshad pa snga ma nyid legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the former explanation, which is in accordance with the context, is better.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i go rims brjod pa'i don la tshad ma grub pa'i klad du bshad zin to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i go rims brjod pa'i don la tshad ma grub pa'i klad du bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the statement of the order of the desired [points] has already been explained at the beginning of the treatise, which establishes the valid means of knowledge.

original: gal te de ltar gyur na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa de ci 'dra ba zhig tu rnam par gnas zhes dogs pa bsu nas slob dpon gyi thugs la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pas /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa de ci 'dra ba zhig tu rnam par gnas zhes dogs pa bsu nas slob dpon gyi thugs la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pas /
translated: If it were like that, then what would be the nature of that inference for the sake of others? Anticipating this doubt, the master [Dharmakƒ´rti] states the nature that exists in his mind.

original: de la zhes bya ba ste rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i de ma thag par gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ste rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i de ma thag par gyur ba na'o //
translated: There, in the immediate aftermath of the inference for one's own sake.

original: gzhan don rjes su dpag pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan don rjes su dpag pa ni /
translated: The inference for the sake of others

original: rang gis mthong ba'i don rab tu gsal bar byed pa nyid du rnam par gnas kyi /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba'i don rab tu gsal bar byed pa nyid du rnam par gnas kyi /
translated: is established as the very thing that illuminates the meaning that one has seen.

original: lung la sogs pas gzhan gyis mthong ba rab tu gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lung la sogs pas gzhan gyis mthong ba rab tu gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the illumination of what is seen by others through scripture and so forth. This is the meaning.

original: rang gis mthong ba'i don ni tshad mas mthong ba'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba'i don ni tshad mas mthong ba'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags te /
translated: The meaning that one sees is the reason of the three modes that is seen by a valid cognition.

original: rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is a clear expression.

original: 'dis gsal bar byed pa na zhes bya ba'i bshad pas ni tshig la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dis gsal bar byed pa na zhes bya ba'i bshad pas ni tshig la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The commentary ‚Äúwhen this is a clear expression‚Äù includes the words, etc.

original: 'di rnam par 'grel ba ni rang gi zhes bya ba ste rgol ba la sogs pa'i bdag gis so //
analyzed: 'di rnam par 'grel ba ni rang gi zhes bya ba ste rgol ba la sogs pa'i bdag gis so //
translated: The commentary ‚Äúone‚Äôs own‚Äù means that the proponent, etc.,

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba rang gis zhes gsungs so //üîΩgang gi tshe rgol ba yang dag pa'i sgrub byed brjod pas ston par byed pa de'i tshe phyir rgol ba yang dag ba ma yin pa'i nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir bstan par bya ba nyed yin la ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba rang gis zhes gsungs so // gang gi tshe rgol ba yang dag pa'i sgrub byed brjod pas ston par byed pa de'i tshe phyir rgol ba yang dag ba ma yin pa'i nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir bstan par bya ba nyed yin la ;
translated: themselves. For that very reason, it says ‚Äúthe proponent and the opponent themselves.‚ÄùüîΩWhen the proponent teaches by stating a correct proof, then the opponent teaches by stating a correct fault.üîΩWhen the proponent teaches by stating a correct fault,

original: gang gi phyir rgol ba yang dag pa'i nyes pa brjod pas ston par byed pa yin pa de'i tshe ni /üîΩrgol ba ma dag pa'i sgrub par byed pa brjod pas bstan par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgol ba yang dag pa'i nyes pa brjod pas ston par byed pa yin pa de'i tshe ni /üîΩrgol ba ma dag pa'i sgrub par byed pa brjod pas bstan par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: then the opponent teaches by stating a correct proof.

original: des na rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba bstan par bya ba dang ston par byed pa dag rang gis rab tu gsal bar byed @3a * //
analyzed: des na rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba bstan par bya ba dang ston par byed pa dag rang gis rab tu gsal bar byed @3a * //
translated: Therefore, the proponent and opponent are the one who teaches and the one who is taught, and they are to be clearly distinguished by themselves.

original: pa zhes bya ba la ltos so //
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba la ltos so //
translated: Therefore, the proponent and opponent are the one who teaches and the one who is taught, and they are called ‚Äúthe one who illuminates himself.‚ÄùüîΩIn dependence on what?

original: de dag gis ci zhig rab tu gsal bar byed snyam na /
analyzed: de dag gis ci zhig rab tu gsal bar byed snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat does he illuminate?‚Äù

original: rang gis mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúhis own seeing.‚Äù

original: gal te gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa 'di dag kho na la rang gis mthong ba rab tu gsal bar byed pa yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa 'di dag kho na la rang gis mthong ba rab tu gsal bar byed pa yin nam snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúAre only these inferences for the sake of others the illumination of his own seeing?‚Äù

original: gal te zhes smos so //üîΩde'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: gal te zhes smos so // de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf.‚Äù

original: de dag rnams kyang zhes sbyar te drug ba 'di yang byed pa la sogs su yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang zhes sbyar te drug ba 'di yang byed pa la sogs su yin no //
translated: At that time, it is said, ‚Äúthey also,‚Äù and this sixth case is also used for the agent and so on.

original: de dag 'ba' zhig rang gis mthong ba gsal bar byed pa yin bar ni ma zad de /
analyzed: de dag 'ba' zhig rang gis mthong ba gsal bar byed pa yin bar ni ma zad de /
translated: Not only do they illuminate their own seeing,

original: de dag gis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mthong ba'o //
translated: but they also see that.

original: gal te mtshan nyid bstan pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i ched kho nar ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid bstan pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i ched kho nar ma yin nam /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt the teaching of the definition only for the purpose of dispelling misconceptions?‚Äù

original: 'dis ni lung las gzhan gyis mthong ba yang sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i log bar rtogs pa bsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni lung las gzhan gyis mthong ba yang sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i log bar rtogs pa bsal ba ma yin no //
translated: This does not eliminate the misconception that inference is also established by scripture, other than by perception.

original: des na mtshan nyid 'dis log par rtogs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid 'dis log par rtogs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, this characteristic is called ‚Äúmisconception.‚Äù

original: shugs nyid las zhes bya ba ni rang gis mthong ba'i don smos pa'i shugs las /
analyzed: shugs nyid las zhes bya ba ni rang gis mthong ba'i don smos pa'i shugs las /
translated: ‚ÄúBy implication‚Äù means that by the implication of the statement of the object that is perceived by oneself,

original: lung las mthong ba rab tu gsal bar byed pa rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i log par rtogs ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: lung las mthong ba rab tu gsal bar byed pa rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i log par rtogs ba bsal ba yin no //
translated: the misconception that inference is the revelation of what is perceived by scripture is eliminated.

original: de yang zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to

original: des na rang bzhin gnyis ka yang gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin gnyis ka yang gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: the object that is perceived by oneself. Therefore, both natures are revealed.

original: gang zhig gsal bar byed pa rang gis mthong ba de gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: gang zhig gsal bar byed pa rang gis mthong ba de gang yin snyam na /
translated: If one wonders what is revealed by oneself,

original: rang gis mthong ba'i don zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba'i don zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said to be ‚Äúthe object that is perceived by oneself.‚Äù

original: don med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a nonexistent object.

original: 'dis ni rtog pas sgro btags pa rtags ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtog pas sgro btags pa rtags ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This states that superimposition by conception is not a reason.

original: don yin yang thams cad ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni tshul gsum pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don yin yang thams cad ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni tshul gsum pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the third mode‚Äù shows that although the reason is present, it is not present in all similar instances.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshul gsum pa dang / rtags zhes gang brjod pa de gnyi ga yang pha rol bo spong ba'o //üîΩtshul gsum pa zhes bya ba ga las yin la /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshul gsum pa dang / rtags zhes gang brjod pa de gnyi ga yang pha rol bo spong ba'o // tshul gsum pa zhes bya ba ga las yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif . . . ‚Äù and so on shows that both the third mode and the reason are rejected by the opponent.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin the third mode‚Äù is connected with the phrase ‚Äúhow could it be a reason?‚Äù

original: rtags zhes kyang ga las yin zhes so sor 'brel to //
analyzed: rtags zhes kyang ga las yin zhes so sor 'brel to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhow could it be a reason?‚Äù is connected with the phrase ‚Äúin the third mode.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba 'di la pha rol po gtan tshigs smra ba ni rang gis mthong don smos pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba 'di la pha rol po gtan tshigs smra ba ni rang gis mthong don smos pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent who is speaking about the reason in this proof is the one who says, ‚ÄúI will state the object that I have seen.‚Äù

original: don tsam yin pas rjes su dpag par bya ba yang ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don tsam yin pas rjes su dpag par bya ba yang ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is the mere object, because it is what is to be inferred.

original: gang gi tshe rjes su dpog pa po du ba la sogs pa las me la sogs pa'i don rtogs pa de'i tshe de rang gis mthong ba yin pa'i phyir de yang @3b rang gis mthong don smos pas ston pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rjes su dpog pa po du ba la sogs pa las me la sogs pa'i don rtogs pa de'i tshe de rang gis mthong ba yin pa'i phyir de yang @3b rang gis mthong don smos pas ston pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the inferential cognizer realizes the object, such as fire, from the reason, such as smoke, at that time, the reason is what he has seen, and therefore he would be stating the object that he has seen.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would be the problem with that?

original: des na zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, the author of the treatise says,üîΩThe reply to that is: ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that proves something for others is not a reason that proves something for oneself.üîΩThe reason that proves something for oneself is not a reason that proves something for others.üîΩThere is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.üîΩHowever, there is a reason that proves something for others that is a trimodal reason.üîΩIf you say that the reason that proves something for others is merely a cause of understanding for others,

original: lan ni 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the author of the treatise says,üîΩ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that proves something for others is not a reason that proves something for oneself.üîΩThe reason that proves something for oneself is not a reason that proves something for others.üîΩThere is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.üîΩHowever, there is a reason that proves something for others that is a trimodal reason.

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba gzhan gyi ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba gzhan gyi ste /
translated: If you say that the reason that proves something for others is merely a cause of understanding for others,üîΩthe author of the treatise says,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gsal byed ni yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gsal byed ni yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that proves something for others is not a reason that proves something for oneself.üîΩThe reason that proves something for oneself is not a reason that proves something for others.üîΩThere is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.

original: /'on kyang tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid kyis gsal bar byed pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: /'on kyang tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid kyis gsal bar byed pa yod pa yin no //
translated: However, there is a reason that proves something for others that is a trimodal reason.

original: gzhan la gsal bar byed pa med pa'i rgyu tsam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la gsal bar byed pa med pa'i rgyu tsam zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason that proves something for others is merely a cause of understanding for others,

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the author of the treatise says,üîΩ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that proves something for others is not a reason that proves something for oneself.üîΩThe reason that proves something for oneself is not a reason that proves something for others.

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin de ni brjod kyang gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba mi nus pa de'i phyir na bsgrub par bya ba la ni gsal bar byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin de ni brjod kyang gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba mi nus pa de'i phyir na bsgrub par bya ba la ni gsal bar byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.üîΩHowever, there is a reason that proves something for others that is a trimodal reason.üîΩIf you say that the reason that proves something for others is merely a cause of understanding for others,

original: nus pa brjod pa'i tshig ni gsal byed yin te tshad mas grub pa'i don brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa brjod pa'i tshig ni gsal byed yin te tshad mas grub pa'i don brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the author of the treatise says,üîΩ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as a reason that proves something for others.‚Äù

original: mi nus ba brjod pa'i tshig ni gsal byed ma yin te bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus ba brjod pa'i tshig ni gsal byed ma yin te bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason that proves something for others is not a reason that proves something for oneself.üîΩThe reason

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa ci ltar gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa ci ltar gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the probandum is not stated, how can it be illuminated?

original: gang la zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang la zhes smos so //
translated: ‚Äú In regard to which‚Äù is stated.

original: don gang la bstan par bya ba gzhan no //
analyzed: don gang la bstan par bya ba gzhan no //
translated: The object in regard to which something is to be taught is different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan yid ches pa'i yul la gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan yid ches pa'i yul la gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú For that very reason‚Äù means: for that very reason that it is called ‚Äúillumination‚Äù in regard to the domain of another‚Äôs conviction.

original: rab kyi tshig ces bya ba ni rang gis mthong don rab gsal byed //
analyzed: rab kyi tshig ces bya ba ni rang gis mthong don rab gsal byed //
translated: ‚Äú The word ‚Äòpra‚Äô ‚Äù means: one‚Äôs own seen object is illuminated.

original: ces bya ba ni 'dir rab tu sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'dir rab tu sbyar ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the application of ‚Äúpra‚Äù.

original: tshad mas ma rtogs pa la ltos nas tshad mas rtogs pa yang khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas ma rtogs pa la ltos nas tshad mas rtogs pa yang khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //

original: gzhan ni bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: The other is what is to be taught.

analyzed: de lta na 'o na bsgrub par bya ba yang gzhan dag tshad mas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the probandum is also realized by valid cognition in regard to others.

original: des na de la yang rab tu gsal bar byed pa yod do snyam na /
analyzed: des na de la yang rab tu gsal bar byed pa yod do snyam na /
translated: Therefore, in that case, there is also illumination in regard to that.

original: gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes smos so //
translated: If that is so, then ‚Äúif‚Äù is stated.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni rtags 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni rtags 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Also‚Äù means: not only the mere reason.

original: rtsod pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba grub zin pa'i phyir na dam bca' ba rjod pa don med do //
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba grub zin pa'i phyir na dam bca' ba rjod pa don med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no dispute‚Äù means that because the probandum has already been established, the statement of the thesis is pointless.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba grub zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba grub zin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: ci ltar dam bca' pa brjod pa don med pa de bzhin du rtags brjod pa yang don med par 'gyur te /

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the probandum has not been established.

original: tshul gsum pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i zhes smos so //

original: tshig ces bya ba ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWords‚Äù means that which makes the triply characterized reason clear.

original: de las ni tshig las so //
analyzed: de las ni tshig las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the words.

original: de yang ni @4a * //
analyzed: de yang ni @4a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means

original: tshig gis so //
analyzed: tshig gis so //
translated: from the words.

original: gzhan gyi gal te zhes smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gal te zhes smos te /
translated: The opponent says ‚Äúif‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i cho tshig gzhan gyi don gyi mong du yang 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i cho tshig gzhan gyi don gyi mong du yang 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù connects to ‚Äúthe words would also be common to other objects.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the response.

original: ci ltar tshul gsum pa'i tshig las bzung zin pa'i 'brel pa dran par gyur pa na /
analyzed: ci ltar tshul gsum pa'i tshig las bzung zin pa'i 'brel pa dran par gyur pa na /
translated: Just as the triply characterized words are remembered from the grasped connection,

original: phyogs kyi chos bzung ba las rjes dpag skye ba de bzhin du tshig las mngon sum ni skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos bzung ba las rjes dpag skye ba de bzhin du tshig las mngon sum ni skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as inference is produced from the apprehension of the property of the position, so too, direct perception is not produced from words.

original: 'di ga las shen /
analyzed: 'di ga las shen /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshul gsum zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshul gsum zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe triply characterized.‚Äù

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bstan bar bya ba la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bstan bar bya ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf another‚Äù refers to the object of instruction.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ces /
translated: This is what he is saying:

analyzed: tshig ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag ba'i rgyu yin pas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par brjod kyi /

original: gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum du ni ma yin te /

original: tshig ni mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩgal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum yin no zhes ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ni mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum yin no zhes ston par byed pa'o //
translated: because words are not the cause of direct perception.‚ÄùüîΩIf, etc. shows that the opponent maintains that words are the direct perception for another because they are the cause of the direct perception for another.

original: tshig 'di ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin pa des na tshig 'di gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshig 'di ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin pa des na tshig 'di gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSince these words are the cause of direct perception, these words are the direct perception for another.‚Äù

original: lan ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response is No, and so on.

original: ma tshang bar mngon sum skyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma tshang bar mngon sum skyed pa ni ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: ri dags rgyug pa la ltos zhes brjod ba dang yang ngo don 'di yin te /
analyzed: ri dags rgyug pa la ltos zhes brjod ba dang yang ngo don 'di yin te /
translated: The response is Look at the running deer, and the meaning is this:

original: mngon du phyogs par gyur par rung ba nyid la ni mngon sum srid pas khyab par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon du phyogs par gyur par rung ba nyid la ni mngon sum srid pas khyab par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: It is understood that the possibility of a direct perception is pervaded by the suitability of being directed toward an object.

original: des na mngon du phyogs par rung ba'i mchan nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa ltos zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs pa las mngon sum skye bar srid pa de rjes su dpog pa skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na mngon du phyogs par rung ba'i mchan nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa ltos zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs pa las mngon sum skye bar srid pa de rjes su dpog pa skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the response Look at the suitability of being directed toward an object is understood in that way. The possibility of the arising of a direct perception is inferred from that.

original: de ma thag par ni mngon sum skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag par ni mngon sum skye ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that a direct perception arises immediately.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa nyid de ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa nyid de ma thag pa yin no //

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //

original: ri dags la sogs ba'i don la mngon du phyogs pa /
analyzed: ri dags la sogs ba'i don la mngon du phyogs pa /

original: mngon sum srid pas khyab pa bdag nyid la sngar mthong ba la rtogs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon sum srid pas khyab pa bdag nyid la sngar mthong ba la rtogs par bya ba ste /
translated: Since it is possible that it is direct perception, it is understood that it is in one‚Äôs own continuum, as previously seen.

original: ltos zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: ltos zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúif‚Äù is used in the application.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: gang zhig don gang la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa de ni mtshang ba dang gags  byed pa med na don de mngon sum du byed pa can yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig don gang la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa de ni mtshang ba dang gags  byed pa med na don de mngon sum du byed pa can yin te /
translated: Whatever is directed toward a certain object, if there is no obstruction or impediment, it is direct perception of that object,

original: dper na khyed dam pa'i sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khyed dam pa'i sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: just as you, the opponent, were in the previous situation.

original: khyod kyang don de la mngon @4b du phyogs par rung ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyod kyang don de la mngon @4b du phyogs par rung ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //

original: gal te nges par sbyor bar byed pa po ni nges par sbyor ba'i tshig gis bdag nyid kyi don de la mngon du phyogs pa'i dngos po mi brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nges par sbyor bar byed pa po ni nges par sbyor ba'i tshig gis bdag nyid kyi don de la mngon du phyogs pa'i dngos po mi brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the one who is definitely applying is not expressing the fact that he is directed toward that object by the words of the application,

original: des na bstan par bya bas don de la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa ma rtogs par bdag nyid la de mi srid par dgos pa na /
analyzed: des na bstan par bya bas don de la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa ma rtogs par bdag nyid la de mi srid par dgos pa na /

original: de la de'i mngon sum don du gnyer bas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la de'i mngon sum don du gnyer bas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
translated: To anticipate the objection, he says, I do not say that.

original: nga yis zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: nga yis zhes bya bas so //
translated: The phrase by me refers to the author of the treatise.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ring gsal sogs pa'i don rtogs pa bo ngas rtogs la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ring gsal sogs pa'i don rtogs pa bo ngas rtogs la /
translated: The phrase in that way refers to the understanding of the meaning of long, short, and so on.

original: bstan par bya ba la yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba la yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase I have understood refers to the teaching of the treatise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdon gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / don gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum gyi don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can brjod pa'i shugs kyis so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can brjod pa'i shugs kyis so //
translated: The phrase by means of the object refers to the fact that the statement is preceded by the admission that the object of perception is a necessary condition.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: tshig de brjod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig de brjod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

original: gal te nges par sbyor bar byed pa po mngon du phyogs par gyur ba ci 'dra bas mngon sum dang ldan pa de 'dra ba ni nges par sbyor ba tshig las mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nges par sbyor bar byed pa po mngon du phyogs par gyur ba ci 'dra bas mngon sum dang ldan pa de 'dra ba ni nges par sbyor ba tshig las mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the one who is engaged in the ascertainment is the one who is directed to the perception, then the ascertainment would not be from the statement.

original: de ci ltar na de'i mngon sum don du gnyer ba de la 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na de'i mngon sum don du gnyer ba de la 'jug snyam na /
translated: How then could the one who is engaged in the ascertainment of the object of perception be engaged in that?

original: mngon du phyogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúApproaching‚Äù is the same.

original: nges par sbyor ba bo'i nga'i mngon du phyogs ba ci 'dra ba de ltar khyod la yang de 'dra ba kho nar de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par bya ba'i nges par sbyor ba'i tshig gi 'bras bu mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba ni shugs kyis bstanüîΩba yin no //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba bo'i nga'i mngon du phyogs ba ci 'dra ba de ltar khyod la yang de 'dra ba kho nar de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par bya ba'i nges par sbyor ba'i tshig gi 'bras bu mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba ni shugs kyis bstan ba yin no //
translated: The result of the statement of the proof is indirectly indicated by the statement, ‚ÄúJust as the approaching of the proof is like that, so also is your approaching.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin par ni mngon sum gyi rgyu nyid du khas blang bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par ni mngon sum gyi rgyu nyid du khas blang bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable to accept it as the cause of perception.

original: mngon sum gyis rgyu'i phyogs la ni 'di rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rgyu'i phyogs la ni 'di rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
