original: mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary statement is ‚ÄúTherefore . . .‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni brjod zin pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni brjod zin pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù is in the manner that has been described.

original: mngon du phyogs par gyur pa la zhes bya ba 'di ni thun mong ba ste mngon sum bskyed pa nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs par gyur pa la zhes bya ba 'di ni thun mong ba ste mngon sum bskyed pa nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúApproaching‚Äù is a general term; it does not refer to the production of perception.

original: rgyu rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni tshig rnams kyi'o zhes de ltar dran pa'i skyes bu ni nges par sbyar bar bya ba ni mngon du phyogs pa la 'dug pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni tshig rnams kyi'o zhes de ltar dran pa'i skyes bu ni nges par sbyar bar bya ba ni mngon du phyogs pa la 'dug pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOf the causes‚Äù means of the words. The person who remembers in this way is ‚Äúengaged‚Äù in the direction of the object.

original: rgyu de'i phyir na nges par sbyor ba'i tshig ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te tshul gsum pa'i rtags gsal bar byed pas na rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir na nges par sbyor ba'i tshig ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te tshul gsum pa'i rtags gsal bar byed pas na rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For this reason, the words of engagement are inference itself, because they are the cause of inference, since they make known the reason having the three modes.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na rjes su dpag pas @5a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na rjes su dpag pas @5a * //
translated: Since this is the case, the words of engagement are inference.

original: te ; de la mngon du phyogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rtags kyis mngon sum srid par bltas te /
analyzed: te ; de la mngon du phyogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rtags kyis mngon sum srid par bltas te /
translated: In this regard, the reason having the characteristic of direction is seen to be possible for direct perception.

original: nges par sbyor ba'i tshig las mngon du phyogs pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba'i tshig las mngon du phyogs pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that from the words of engagement, there is engagement in the direction.

original: de lta na 'on zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'on zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: In this way, the opponent says ‚ÄúIf that is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'o na ni bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis nges par sbyor ba po'i mngon sum gyi yul la /
analyzed: 'o na ni bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis nges par sbyor ba po'i mngon sum gyi yul la /
translated: If that is so, then the object of the direct perception of the one who engages is the object of the words of engagement.

original: nges pa sbyor ba'i tshig las /
analyzed: nges pa sbyor ba'i tshig las /
translated: The words of the proof

original: gang zhig don gang la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa srid pa'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig don gang la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa srid pa'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: are: ‚ÄúWhatever is directed toward an object . . .‚Äù and so on. This is an inference for others.

original: rtags 'jug pa ste gsal ba na rang bzhin gyi rtags tshul gsum yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtags 'jug pa ste gsal ba na rang bzhin gyi rtags tshul gsum yin pa'o //
translated: When the reason is stated, the reason is a property of the subject and the three modes are stated.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na tshig gi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs tshul gsum pa ni gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na tshig gi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs tshul gsum pa ni gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúSo what? What is the problem with that?‚Äù the answer is that the three modes of a verbal effect reason are not stated.

original: khyab pa nyid tshig gis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid tshig gis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the pervasion is stated by words.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos nyid ni dngos su grub pa kho na yin pas de la ni tshig dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos nyid ni dngos su grub pa kho na yin pas de la ni tshig dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The property of the subject is established directly, so there is no need for words in that case.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show this, [Dharmakƒ´rti] says, ‚ÄúIt is like this . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: des na 'bras bu'i rtags brjod pa'i gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i rtags brjod pa'i gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the statement of a reason based on effect would not be an inference for others.

original: tshul gnyis pa'i rtags brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gnyis pa'i rtags brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: This is because the statement of a reason based on the two modes is made.

original: 'on te tshul gnyis ston par byed pa'i brjod pa yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te tshul gnyis ston par byed pa'i brjod pa yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the statement that shows the two modes is also an inference for the sake of others,

original: des na gzhan gyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi zhes bya'o //
translated: then it is called ‚Äúfor the sake of others.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThat is . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni bzung ba brjod pa'i 'brel pa dran pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni bzung ba brjod pa'i 'brel pa dran pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Then‚Äù means because it is for the purpose of recalling the connection that was stated.

original: de la ni 'brel pa brjod ba'i tshig la'o //
analyzed: de la ni 'brel pa brjod ba'i tshig la'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the words that state the connection.

original: tshad brjod ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshad brjod ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Stating the measure‚Äù refers to the words of an inference for the sake of others.

original: mngon sum gyi don la ci ste ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don la ci ste ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the case that it is for the sake of direct perception?

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúDirect perception . . .‚Äù

original: gal te tshad mas rtogs pa la tshig don med par rnam 'grel mdzad pas brjod dam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshad mas rtogs pa la tshig don med par rnam 'grel mdzad pas brjod dam zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúDid the author of the Commentary say that the words are meaningless for the one who understands through valid knowledge?‚Äù

original: mkhas pa rnams la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFor the wise . . .‚Äù

original: gal te 'di ci ltar shes par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ci ltar shes par byed pa yin te /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is this understood?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'dir khyab pa grub pa'i phyir de brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir khyab pa grub pa'i phyir de brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not because the pervasion is established here that it is stated.

original: ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not established, the reason alone is to be stated.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the same way,

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad de 'di ltar yang blta bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad de 'di ltar yang blta bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: this is merely an illustration, and it is also to be seen in this way.

original: 'dis ni rtogs pa po ma rmongs pa'i @5b dbang du byas nas phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa rnams las tshul gcig grub na tshul gnyis ston pa yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtogs pa po ma rmongs pa'i @5b dbang du byas nas phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa rnams las tshul gcig grub na tshul gnyis ston pa yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that when one mode is established from the property of the position and so on, the presentation of the two modes is also inference for the sake of others, from the perspective of the one who understands.

original: de rtogs pa yang skabs la sogs pa las rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa yang skabs la sogs pa las rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that understanding is to be understood from the context and so on.

original: rtogs pa bo rmongs pa'i dbang du byas nas ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston pa gzhan gyi rjes su don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa bo rmongs pa'i dbang du byas nas ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston pa gzhan gyi rjes su don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the perspective of the confused one who understands, the presentation of the reason with three modes is called inference for the sake of others.

original: der yang zhes mngon sum du mthong ba'i du ba la'ang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes mngon sum du mthong ba'i du ba la'ang ngo //
translated: Also refers to the smoke that is directly seen.

original: gal te mngon sum du grub pa la tshig dgos pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum du grub pa la tshig dgos pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, What is the need for words in the case of what is established by direct perception?

original: tshig gi don ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, The meaning of the words....

original: 'di du ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te dgos pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de tshul gsum pa'i rtags gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di du ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te dgos pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de tshul gsum pa'i rtags gsal ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the words this is smoke is the purpose. The purpose is the establishment of the reason having the three modes, as will be explained.

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa ston pa ni tshig gi dogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa ston pa ni tshig gi dogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that the establishment by direct perception is not the meaning of the words.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba ste sa phyogs su'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba ste sa phyogs su'o //
translated: To express just that, it is said, There, meaning in the place.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i don te rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i don te rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The meaning seen by direct perception is the particular characteristic.

original: de ni zhes bya ba tshig ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin gyi gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba tshig ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin gyi gzhan gyi don gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of that is that the words are inference for the sake of others, not direct perception for the sake of others.

original: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the reason for the inference.

original: tshig 'di ci ltar de'i rang bzhin can gyi rang bzhin gyi tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin pa de de ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshig 'di ci ltar de'i rang bzhin can gyi rang bzhin gyi tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin pa de de ston pa ni /
translated: How is this statement an inference, since it shows the reason that has the nature of the property of the subject?

original: 'di ni du ba nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni du ba nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the reason: ‚ÄúBecause it is smoke.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar na yang tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa ci ltar yin te /
translated: Even if it is so, how does it show the reason that has the three modes?

original: 'brel ba ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel ba ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the connection is not stated.

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To this, he says ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: yang ci ltar rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not transformed into another form?

original: de'i zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i zhes smos te /
translated: To this, he says ‚Äúthat,‚Äù

original: sngar dmigs pa'i du ba dang rang bzhin mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar dmigs pa'i du ba dang rang bzhin mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar in nature to the smoke that was previously observed.

original: gal te don 'di tshig gis dngos su bstan to zhes 'jig rten tha snyad byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don 'di tshig gis dngos su bstan to zhes 'jig rten tha snyad byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that people in the world say that this meaning is directly indicated by the words?

original: des na ci ltar de'i tshig mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar de'i tshig mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how is the word not the cause of perception?

original: dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to remove doubt, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore . . . ‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'di du ba'o zhes brjod pas mngon sum du mthong ba bstan par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'di du ba'o zhes brjod pas mngon sum du mthong ba bstan par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that the word ‚Äúsmoke‚Äù is taught to be seen by perception.

original: 'o na tshig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na tshig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut the word . . . ‚Äù and so on is the opponent‚Äôs response.

original: gal te mngon sum la sgra'i byed pa med na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum la sgra'i byed pa med na /
translated: If the word has no role in perception,

original: 'o na tshig ni zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'o na tshig ni zhes sbyar ro //
translated: then why does he say, ‚ÄúBut the word . . . ‚Äù?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i zhes bya ba rang bzhin rjes @6a * //üîΩsu dpog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba rang bzhin rjes @6a * // su dpog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause . . . the nature . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe word is not the cause of the inference of the nature of the object.

original: tshig ni rgyu rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin te zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: tshig ni rgyu rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin te zhes 'brel to //
translated: The word is not the cause of the inference of the object.

original: rgyu rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa'i tshig de gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa'i tshig de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that word that is not the cause of the inference of the object?

original: 'di na du ba yod do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di na du ba yod do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúHere there is smoke. ‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshig ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause . . . the word . . . ‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mthar ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni /
translated: In the philosophical system,

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang rgyu rjes su dpag pa ni yod pa ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang rgyu rjes su dpag pa ni yod pa ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the case of inference for one‚Äôs own sake, there is no inference of the reason.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa kho nar rgyu rjes su dpag pa med do zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa kho nar rgyu rjes su dpag pa med do zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught. It is not the case that there is no inference of the reason in inference for the sake of others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang don zhes smos te /
analyzed: rang don zhes smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúfor one‚Äôs own sake.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de rang don rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yang bar du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de rang don rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yang bar du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'jug go //
translated: Not only in the case of inference for the sake of others, but also in the case of inference for one‚Äôs own sake, the reason by nature is stated in the middle.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: du ba'i rang bzhin la te /
analyzed: du ba'i rang bzhin la te /
translated: In the case of smoke by nature.

original: de'i du ba ni de'i rang bzhin can gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i du ba ni de'i rang bzhin can gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the smoke there is the nature of the inference that has that as its nature.

original: bar du rang bzhin gyi rtags zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bar du rang bzhin gyi rtags zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the reason by nature stated in the middle?

original: der yang zhes smos te du ba'i rang bzhin la yang dpyod pa'o zhes bya ba rjes su dpog pa po rang bzhin rtags te de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa med par 'khrul pa ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der yang zhes smos te du ba'i rang bzhin la yang dpyod pa'o zhes bya ba rjes su dpog pa po rang bzhin rtags te de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa med par 'khrul pa ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Also means that the nature of smoke is also analyzed. The one who infers is the reason of the nature, but the inference of that nature does not stop the error of non-existence.

original: des na rang don gyi rjes su dpag par yang rgyu rjes su dpag pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rang don gyi rjes su dpag par yang rgyu rjes su dpag pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, even in inference for one's own sake, there is no inference of the reason. This is the meaning.

original: yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid la 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs med do zhes pha rol po ston pa ni /üîΩ'dir smras pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid la 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs med do zhes pha rol po ston pa ni / 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Again, to show to the opponent that in inference for the sake of others, there is no effect reason,üîΩit is said, Here it is said... up to ...

original: zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: in this regard...

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pas bar bcad pa dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pas bar bcad pa dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la'o //
translated: Here, in the inference of that nature, there is an interruption and an effect reason.

original: ci ste mi nyams snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste mi nyams snyam na /
translated: If one thinks it does not deteriorate,

original: de ni bar du zhes smos te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs de ni'o //
analyzed: de ni bar du zhes smos te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs de ni'o //
translated: it is said, That effect reason...

original: rang gi don gyi zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: For one's own sake is explained.

original: gang du nye bar mkho zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du nye bar mkho zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwherever it is needed‚Äù means ‚Äúwherever there is no contradiction.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gal te yang rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par du ba 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin pa de lta na yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te yang rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par du ba 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin pa de lta na yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Even though smoke is a logical reason based on effect in the case of an inference for oneself, it is also a logical reason based on effect in the case of an inference for another.

original: dang po du ba la la mthong ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: dang po du ba la la mthong ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: When one first sees smoke, it is a logical reason based on effect.

original: de'i rjes la 'khrul pa srid pas de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa byed pa'i dus su ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'khrul pa srid pas de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa byed pa'i dus su ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: Later, because error is possible, when one makes an inference based on that, it is a logical reason based on nature.

original: phyis ni rgyu rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis ni rgyu rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: After that, one infers the cause.

original: de la gal te yang de'i rang @6b bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pas bar chod pa de lta na yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid ni mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de la gal te yang de'i rang @6b bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pas bar chod pa de lta na yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid ni mi 'gal lo //
translated: Even though it is interrupted by an inference based on nature, it is still a logical reason based on effect, and there is no contradiction.

original: de ltar na rgyu rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the inference of the cause is only an introduction.

original: 'o na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par yang rgyu rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par yang rgyu rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam na /
translated: But in the case of inference for the sake of others, the reason would be inferred only.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn inference for the sake of others,‚ÄùüîΩand so on.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshig nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshig nyid yin la /
translated: Inference for the sake of others is just the statement,

original: tshig kyang dngos su rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ston par byed pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: tshig kyang dngos su rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ston par byed pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /
translated: and the statement directly shows the reason based on the nature of things, so it is an inference based on the nature of things.

original: des ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in inference for the sake of others, there is no reason based on effect.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs med pas na /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs med pas na /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means because there is no reason based on effect.

original: me rjes su dpog pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: me rjes su dpog pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
translated: ‚Äú The inference of fire‚Äù is the establishment of the cause.

original: lan ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: ji ltar srid pa zhes bya ba 'di ni du ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rang bzhin la brten nas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa zhes bya ba 'di ni du ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rang bzhin la brten nas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is smoke, because it is an existent‚Äù is an inference for the sake of another that is based on nature.

original: 'bras bu la brten nas ni ma yin na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu la brten nas ni ma yin na'o //
translated: It is not based on effect.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba rgyu la gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid de med de /
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba rgyu la gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid de med de /
translated: ‚ÄúFor another‚Äù means that an inference for the sake of another does not exist in relation to a cause.

original: bstan bcos las ni rang bzhin la brten nas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni rang bzhin la brten nas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The treatise master states that an inference for the sake of another is based on nature.

original: gang yang 'gal ba ci zhig yod ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de yang rtogs pa po 'khrul pa la ltos pa kho nas 'thad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang 'gal ba ci zhig yod ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de yang rtogs pa po 'khrul pa la ltos pa kho nas 'thad pa yin gyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúWhat is the contradiction?‚Äù and so on is tenable only in dependence on the error of the one who understands.

original: rtogs pa po 'khrul pa med pa la ltos nas ni ji ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la mchod pa kho nar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: rtogs pa po 'khrul pa med pa la ltos nas ni ji ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la mchod pa kho nar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir
translated: In dependence on the non-erroneous knower, just as the effect-reason is the only one in an inference for oneself, so it is also in an inference for another.

original: brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates an alternative.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gang du 'khrul pa med pa der ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis chod pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gang du 'khrul pa med pa der ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis chod pa med pa nyid do //
translated: In the case of an effect-reason, where there is no error, there is no obstruction by a natural reason.

original: tshul de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis very method‚Äù refers to what was said about an inference for oneself.

original: dngos kho nar zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid brjod pa med par de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa med pas so //
analyzed: dngos kho nar zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid brjod pa med par de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa med pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly in reality‚Äù means that without stating the property of the subject, there is no natural inference of that.

original: sgra las zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa tsam brjod pa las so //
analyzed: sgra las zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa tsam brjod pa las so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom the word‚Äù means from the mere statement of the relation.

original: rtogs pa po 'khrul pa med pa la ltos nas ni 'brel pa tsam zhig tshig gis brjod kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid ni tshig med par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa po 'khrul pa med pa la ltos nas ni 'brel pa tsam zhig tshig gis brjod kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid ni tshig med par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: But in relation to the non-erroneous knower, the mere relation is expressed by the words, but the property of the position is understood without words.

original: des na 'dir yang du @7a * //
analyzed: des na 'dir yang du @7a * //
translated: Therefore, here also, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù

original: ba ni mchod pa kho nar 'bras bu'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: ba ni mchod pa kho nar 'bras bu'i rtags yin no //
translated: is the effect-evidence for worship.

original: 'di snyam du gal te 'khrul pa nyid med na de brjod pas ci zhig bya snyam ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te 'khrul pa nyid med na de brjod pas ci zhig bya snyam ba ston pa ni /
translated: If there is no error itself, what is the use of expressing it? The answer is:

original: 'khrul ba med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul ba med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no error . . .‚Äù

original: lan ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThe relation . . .‚Äù

original: de ltar na'o na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston pa'o zhes bya ba 'gal lo snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar na'o na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston pa'o zhes bya ba 'gal lo snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then the inference for the sake of another is the statement of the evidence having the three modes, so it contradicts the statement.

original: tshul gsum pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúHaving the three modes . . .‚Äù

original: ji ltar srid par zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa la tshul gsum brjod par bya ba yin gyi ma 'khrul pa la ni ma yin te de'i 'brel pa'i tshig tsam las rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar srid par zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa la tshul gsum brjod par bya ba yin gyi ma 'khrul pa la ni ma yin te de'i 'brel pa'i tshig tsam las rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As much as possible, the three modes should be stated in error, but not in non-error, because it is understood from the mere words of the relation.

original: de ltar na 'di na du ba yod de zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rgyu'i 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ma yin te rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang bsal nas //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di na du ba yod de zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rgyu'i 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ma yin te rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang bsal nas //
translated: Thus, the statement ‚ÄúHere there is smoke‚Äù is not an inference of the effect of a cause, because it is an inference of a nature.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang bsal ba'i phyir gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang bsal ba'i phyir gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having refuted both of these, in order to refute it by another method, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyus byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid de med par ni tshig las tshad ma med kyi 'on kyang tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyus byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid de med par ni tshig las tshad ma med kyi 'on kyang tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin no //
translated: Inference is produced by a cause of inference. Without that, there is no valid knowledge from a statement. However, a statement is valid knowledge because it is the cause of inference.

original: des na 'di tsam nyid rang gis mthong don rab gsal byed ces bya ba 'dir mngon par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di tsam nyid rang gis mthong don rab gsal byed ces bya ba 'dir mngon par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this much is clearly stated by oneself:

original: gang gis gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di mi 'grig par 'gyur pa 'di na du ba yod do zhes brjod pa'i tshig rnams thams cad ni de ltar te rjes su dpag pa'i rgyur brjod par 'dodüîΩpa ma yin no //üîΩ'on te yang ci ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin pa de bzhin du tshig kyang yin gyi /üîΩrjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma gzhan gyi kha nas nye bar 'god pa ni ci skad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di mi 'grig par 'gyur pa 'di na du ba yod do zhes brjod pa'i tshig rnams thams cad ni de ltar te rjes su dpag pa'i rgyur brjod par 'dod pa ma yin no // 'on te yang ci ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin pa de bzhin du tshig kyang yin gyi / rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma gzhan gyi kha nas nye bar 'god pa ni ci skad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because there is no inference of the reason for the inference of the purpose of another, this definition would not be correct.  But in this case, all the words ‚Äúthere is smoke‚Äù are not asserted to be the cause of the inference.üîΩOr, if it is the former position that is being stated by the opponent, ‚ÄúJust as perception and inference are valid cognitions because they are the causes of the conventional, so too are words,

original: tshig kyang tshad ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: tshig kyang tshad ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: but not because they are the causes of inference,‚Äù then the connection is that ‚Äúwords are also valid cognitions.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩtha snyad kyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / tha snyad kyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is that?üîΩHe says ‚Äúbecause of the conventional.‚Äù

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni tshig med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni tshig med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To clarify that, he says ‚Äúwithout words.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu las gzhan du yang tshig tshad mar khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu las gzhan du yang tshig tshad mar khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should accept the validity of a statement that is other than the reason for an inference.

original: sun 'byin pa ni de la bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni de la bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is ‚Äúin that regard, it is said.

original: 'di gsum med par yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dam ci /
analyzed: 'di gsum med par yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dam ci /
translated: ‚Äù The meaning is that even without these three, there is still worldly convention.

original: 'on kyang dran pa las kyang yod @7b pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang dran pa las kyang yod @7b pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is also because of memory that it exists.

original: ci gang 'di tsam gyis dran pa de la tshad ma nyid yin nam ste ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ci gang 'di tsam gyis dran pa de la tshad ma nyid yin nam ste ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The meaning is that is it not the case that memory alone is valid cognition?

original: tha snyad 'jug pa med dam ci zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: tha snyad 'jug pa med dam ci zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that there is no engagement in convention.

original: 'on te dran pa de tshad ma ma yin pa nyid na zhes bya ba la tha snyad kyi rgyu yin yang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'on te dran pa de tshad ma ma yin pa nyid na zhes bya ba la tha snyad kyi rgyu yin yang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: If that memory is not valid cognition, then the meaning is that even though it is the cause of convention, it is not the cause of valid cognition.

original: lan ni de lta bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de lta bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúin that case.

original: de lta bu'i don can ni tha snyad kyi dgos pa can no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don can ni tha snyad kyi dgos pa can no //
translated: ‚Äù The meaning is that it is the purpose of convention.

original: mtshungs pa ni dran pa dang tshig go //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ni dran pa dang tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúSimilar‚Äù refers to memory and words.

original: 'o na ci ltar tshul gsum pa ston par byed pa tshad ma yin zhes dogs pa sel bas tshig le'ur byas pa dang po rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar tshul gsum pa ston par byed pa tshad ma yin zhes dogs pa sel bas tshig le'ur byas pa dang po rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: Well then, how is it that a valid cognition is that which reveals the trimodal [reason]? In order to dispel such doubts, the first verse is commented upon.

original: gang du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Where means in a specific place.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not elsewhere means not by being the cause of a convention.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi rgyu nyid kyis tshig tshad ma yin par mtshan nyid du ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi rgyu nyid kyis tshig tshad ma yin par mtshan nyid du ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
translated: If one asks, Why is it not accepted that the definition of a valid cognition is that it is a statement that is the cause of all inferences?

original: 'dir ni 'di tsam zhig ces gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di tsam zhig ces gsungs te /
translated: Here, it is said, It is only this much.

original: rang gis mthong don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag 'dir ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis tshig tshad ma yin pa 'di tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gis mthong don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag 'dir ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis tshig tshad ma yin pa 'di tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: The statement that has the definition that which expresses what one has seen and so on is here asserted to be only this much: a valid cognition is a statement that is the cause of an inference.

original: gang gis gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir na mtshan nyid 'di mi 'grig par 'gyur ba rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir na mtshan nyid 'di mi 'grig par 'gyur ba rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not the cause of inferring the purpose of another, this definition is not correct, since it is not the cause of inferring the cause.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni tshig thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni tshig thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'di na du ba yod do zhes brjod pa'i tshig ni rang bzhin rjod par byed pa yin yang rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir na rgyu'i rjes dpag gi rgyur yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di na du ba yod do zhes brjod pa'i tshig ni rang bzhin rjod par byed pa yin yang rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir na rgyu'i rjes dpag gi rgyur yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Even though the statement ‚ÄúThere is smoke here‚Äù expresses a property-svabhƒÅva, it is the cause of inferring the cause, because it is the cause of all inferences.

original: 'o na ci zhig brjod par 'dod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig brjod par 'dod snyam na /
translated: What is it that is intended to be expressed?

original: brjod zin pa nyid kyi don brtan par byed pa ni tshig gi rjes su dpag pa nyid de zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brjod zin pa nyid kyi don brtan par byed pa ni tshig gi rjes su dpag pa nyid de zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cause of inference is the cause of inference‚Äù is a verbal inference that stabilizes the meaning that has already been stated.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu ma yin par rang rgyud kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu ma yin par rang rgyud kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of inference is valid cognition, not an autonomous inference that is not the cause of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu de ni rang bzhin gyi rtags kyi rgyu nyid kyang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu de ni rang bzhin gyi rtags kyi rgyu nyid kyang nyams pa med do //
translated: The reason for inference is not undermined as a reason for intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig la tshig thams cad rjes su dpag pa nyid gang yin pa de ltar bstan pa la ni nye bar mkho ba med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig la tshig thams cad rjes su dpag pa nyid gang yin pa de ltar bstan pa la ni nye bar mkho ba med do //
translated: In the case of a definition, it is not necessary to teach that all words are to be inferred.

original: des na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa mi srid kyang mtshan nyid kyi tshig la gnod pa med do zhes dgongs pa'o //üîΩgang gi phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags la ma gtogs pa gzhan la gsal bar @8a * //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa mi srid kyang mtshan nyid kyi tshig la gnod pa med do zhes dgongs pa'o // gang gi phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags la ma gtogs pa gzhan la gsal bar @8a * //
translated: Therefore, although it is impossible for an inference for the sake of others to be an inference of a reason, there is no fault in the definition. This is the intended meaning.

original: byed pa med pa des na tshul gsum ston pa nyid ci ltar srid par rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa yin te /
analyzed: byed pa med pa des na tshul gsum ston pa nyid ci ltar srid par rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa yin te /
translated: Since there is no other way to clarify the trimodal reason, it is an inference in that the trimodal reason is shown as it is possible to be. This is the relevant point.

original: de ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is a reason because it is a cause and because it is an effect.

original: don gyi ni grangs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rtags ston pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: don gyi ni grangs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rtags ston pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: The meaning is that the inference is not the indication of the reason imagined by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: rig byed du smra bas rig byed tshad ma ma yin par thal ba mthong nas 'dri ba ni 'on zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig byed du smra bas rig byed tshad ma ma yin par thal ba mthong nas 'dri ba ni 'on zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Seeing the consequence that the Vedas are not a valid means of knowledge, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka asks, ‚ÄúWell then?‚Äù

original: lan ni der yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni der yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIn that case.‚Äù

original: tshul gsum pa ston par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de rig byed la yang ngo //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa ston par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de rig byed la yang ngo //
translated: It is not only that which teaches the trimodal criterion, but also the Vedas.

original: mngon sum gyi don ston pa ni lhag par zhes pas so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don ston pa ni lhag par zhes pas so //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is taught by ‚Äúespecially.‚Äù

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba mtho ris la sogs pa shin tu dbang po las 'das par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba mtho ris la sogs pa shin tu dbang po las 'das par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that heaven and so on are extremely beyond the senses.

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyis dbang po las 'das pa'i don la rig byed tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyis dbang po las 'das pa'i don la rig byed tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka anticipates an objection: ‚ÄúThe Vedas are a valid means of knowledge regarding a meaning that is beyond the senses because they are not made by a person.‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes 'gog pa'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no trust.

original: tshad ma ni nges par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma ni nges par byed pa yin na /
translated: If a valid means of knowledge is that which brings about ascertainment,

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don ni rig byed las nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don ni rig byed las nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words that transcend the senses is not ascertained from the Vedas.

original: 'on te dbang po las 'das pa'i don la rig byed nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po las 'das pa'i don la rig byed nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that the Vedas ascertain the meaning that transcends the senses,

original: mngon sum bzhin no snyam na /
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin no snyam na /
translated: like perception,

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩci ste rig byed las dbang po las 'das pa'i don thams cad mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni skabs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o // ci ste rig byed las dbang po las 'das pa'i don thams cad mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni skabs te /
translated: then the response is this:

original: brda la ltos pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: brda la ltos pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If you think that the Vedas do not reveal all meanings that transcend the senses, then what is the use of depending on the Vedas?

original: mngon sum ni brnga la ltos nas don ston par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rig byed kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni brnga la ltos nas don ston par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rig byed kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as perception does not reveal its object by depending on a sign, so too the Vedas would not reveal their object by depending on a sign.

original: pha rol pos skad cig ma zhes smras te /
analyzed: pha rol pos skad cig ma zhes smras te /
translated: The opponent says that the Vedas are momentary.

original: sogs pa'i sgras bdag med pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bdag med pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the absence of a self and so on.

original: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni 'khrul pas so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni 'khrul pas so zhes bya ste /
translated: The response to the doubt that the opponent has that the Vedas are the word of God is ‚Äúbecause of error.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pas rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pas rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the Vedas are not understood through inference of momentariness and so on,

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: then the response to that is this:

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ste rig byed la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ste rig byed la'o //
translated: Here also means in the Veda.

original: 'dis ni skad cig ma nyid rjes su dpag pa dang rig byed dag mtshungs pa nyid du bstan to ;
analyzed: 'dis ni skad cig ma nyid rjes su dpag pa dang rig byed dag mtshungs pa nyid du bstan to ;
translated: This shows that the inference and the Veda are similar.

original: / lan ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / lan ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The reply is called inference.

original: yod pa nyid ni chos can sgra la sogs pa la skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni chos can sgra la sogs pa la skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: Existence is the probans for the probandum, momentariness, etc., in the subject, sound, etc.

original: de yang de'i rigs can gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe la skad cig ma nyid dang lhan cig 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhugs pa yin @8b no ;
analyzed: de yang de'i rigs can gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe la skad cig ma nyid dang lhan cig 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhugs pa yin @8b no ;
translated: And that is the inference which establishes the concomitance of existence with momentariness in the example, a pot, etc., which is of the same class.

original: / de nyid kyang yod pa nyid ni skad cig ma med par mi 'gyur ro zhes nges shing yid ches pa'i gnas te rten yin no //
analyzed: / de nyid kyang yod pa nyid ni skad cig ma med par mi 'gyur ro zhes nges shing yid ches pa'i gnas te rten yin no //
translated: And that is the certain and reliable basis for the conclusion that existence is not possible without momentariness.

original: des ni rjes su dpag pa la ni zhes bya ba skad cig ma nyid sgrub par byed pa'i rtags la res 'ga' 'ga' zhig tu skad cig ma nyid med kyang yod par 'gyur srid do snyam pa'i 'khrul pa bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni rjes su dpag pa la ni zhes bya ba skad cig ma nyid sgrub par byed pa'i rtags la res 'ga' 'ga' zhig tu skad cig ma nyid med kyang yod par 'gyur srid do snyam pa'i 'khrul pa bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The phrase in inference in the root text indicates that the reason proving momentariness is a valid means of knowledge, because it eliminates the misconception that momentariness might not exist even though it is possible for it to exist.

original: des na yod pa las skad cig ma nyid rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yod pa las skad cig ma nyid rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inference of momentariness from existence is a valid means of knowledge.

original: rig byed la yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rig byed la yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the Vedas are also like that,üîΩthe root text states,

original: rig byed la ni zhes gsungs te me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag las so //
analyzed: rig byed la ni zhes gsungs te me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag las so //
translated: The Vedas are not like that, meaning that the Vedas are not like the words of the Buddha, such as the fire sacrifice.

original: de'i rigs can gyi tshig gis 'khrul pa bzlog pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i rigs can gyi tshig gis 'khrul pa bzlog pa ma yin no ;
translated: Words of that type do not eliminate misconceptions.

original: / rig byed dang rigs gcig pa'i tshig ni bden pa'i don can du sgrub par byed pa yin la 'di la ni bzlog pa la gnod pa'i tshad ma ci yang med do //
analyzed: / rig byed dang rigs gcig pa'i tshig ni bden pa'i don can du sgrub par byed pa yin la 'di la ni bzlog pa la gnod pa'i tshad ma ci yang med do //
translated: Words that are of the same type as the Vedas are established as having true meanings, and there is no valid means of knowledge that contradicts that.

original: des na nges rig byed la 'khrul pa bzlog pa ma yin te ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na nges rig byed la 'khrul pa bzlog pa ma yin te ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the Vedas do not eliminate misconceptions, because they are not certain.

original: de bas na 'di gnyis ni mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyis ni mi mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, these two are not similar.

original: mi mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni rjes 'gro dang ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dis rjes su 'gro bas na rjes 'gro ni rgyus te bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni rjes 'gro dang ni zhes bya ba'o // 'dis rjes su 'gro bas na rjes 'gro ni rgyus te bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel ba'i rtags so //
translated: The demonstration of the dissimilarity is ‚Äúbecause of the concomitance. ‚ÄùüîΩThat which is the cause, i.e., the reason, which is related to the probandum, is the concomitance.

original: des na 'brel ba yin pas na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'brel ba yin pas na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because of the concomitance, inference is a valid means of knowledge.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa yang tshad ma las nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa yang tshad ma las nges pa kho na'o //
translated: And the relation to the probandum is ascertained only from a valid means of knowledge.

original: rig byed la ni don dang lhan cig 'brel pa mthong ba med do //
analyzed: rig byed la ni don dang lhan cig 'brel pa mthong ba med do //
translated: In the Veda, the relation to the meaning is not seen.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni stong phrag phyed dang bzhi par ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni stong phrag phyed dang bzhi par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù means in the first half of the fourth thousand.

original: 'di ni phyogs kyi chos nyid khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs kyi chos nyid khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by accepting the property of the position.

original: de ni de yang yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni de yang yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: But that also does not exist.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa la yang ldog pa tsam gyis ni go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du yang na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa la yang ldog pa tsam gyis ni go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du yang na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even if it is not produced by a person, the mere reversal does not prove it. In order to teach this, he says ‚Äúor.‚Äù

original: de la ni rig byed la'o //
analyzed: de la ni rig byed la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to the Vedas.

original: 'di ga las she na de la ni zhes bya ba ste rig byed la'o //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na de la ni zhes bya ba ste rig byed la'o //
translated: Why is that? ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to the Vedas.

original: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba dbang po las 'das pa'i don gyi chos can gyi chos med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba dbang po las 'das pa'i don gyi chos can gyi chos med pa nyid do //
translated: The property of the subject is called ‚Äúproperty of the subject.‚Äù It is the absence of a property of the subject that is beyond the senses.

analyzed: skyes bu'i chos nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood as the nature of a person.

original: ci ltar bden pa'i don nyid rjes su 'gro ba med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar bden pa'i don nyid rjes su 'gro ba med snyam na /
translated: If you think that the meaning of truth does not follow,

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //

original: ldog pa ni rig byed kyi tshig go //
analyzed: ldog pa ni rig byed kyi tshig go //

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba khas blangs kyang mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pa ni ma @9a * //
translated: Even if you accept the following, it does not establish what is desired.

original: yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: In order to teach this, he anticipates an objection:

original: ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if you say‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: lan ni 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyang na zla ba bcu gnyis lo yin no zhes bya ba 'dir bden pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba yod med de lta na yang me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag las ci 'ong 'on te de yang rig byed yin pa'i phyir bden pa nyid dang
analyzed: lan ni 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba'o // yang na zla ba bcu gnyis lo yin no zhes bya ba 'dir bden pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba yod med de lta na yang me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag las ci 'ong 'on te de yang rig byed yin pa'i phyir bden pa nyid dang
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThe answer to this is as follows.üîΩ‚Äù Or else, a year is twelve months.üîΩEven though there is no truth or correspondence here, what is the point of fire sacrifices and so on? Or, if you say that they are true because they are Vedic,

original: rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then what is the point of fire sacrifices and so on?

original: ma yin te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskyes bus ma byas pa nyid las rig byed yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // skyes bus ma byas pa nyid las rig byed yin no zhe na /
translated: No, because there is no certainty.üîΩIf you say that they are Vedic because they are not made by a person,

analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis ni zhes bya ba ste rig byed nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i ngag 'di skyes bus byas pa nyid du'ang dogs te ;

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis byas par srid pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ste me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag go //

original: dogs pa 'di sa bon med pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di sa bon med pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba'o //

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni byas pa'i'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni byas pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù refers to the created.

original: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir na dran na de lta bu'i tha snyad yin no zhes yid ches par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir na dran na de lta bu'i tha snyad yin no zhes yid ches par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because there is no confidence, i.e., because there is no valid cognition, one cannot have confidence in the statement ‚ÄúIf one remembers, it is such a convention.‚Äù This is the meaning.

original: gzhan las yang zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs par yang de lta bu'i tha snyad de ni dran na yin no zhes bya ba 'dir thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las yang zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs par yang de lta bu'i tha snyad de ni dran na yin no zhes bya ba 'dir thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn other places‚Äù means that in the KumƒÅrasa·πÉbhava, etc., such a convention is also ‚Äúif one remembers.‚Äù This is the consequence.

original: bstan zin pa ni zhal 'grel le'u dang po la sogs par ro //
analyzed: bstan zin pa ni zhal 'grel le'u dang po la sogs par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù in the first chapter, etc.

original: de bas na tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid rang gis mthong ba'i sgrar 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid rang gis mthong ba'i sgrar 'dod pa yin gyi /

analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te gsal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: pha rol po rang gis mthong don smos pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi don yin na /
analyzed: pha rol po rang gis mthong don smos pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi don yin na /
translated: If the object of one‚Äôs own perception is the meaning of the trimodal logical mark for the opponent,

original: don med pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don med pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the meaningless statement is ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The negation is ‚Äúnot.‚Äù

original: log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don te dgos pa gzhan rang gis mthong don smos pa gang la yod pa ste de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don te dgos pa gzhan rang gis mthong don smos pa gang la yod pa ste de'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the characteristic of the elimination of misconception is the purpose. The other is the one who has it.

original: gal te yang tshul gsum pa'i rtags smos pas kyang bshad pa la ltos te log par rtogs pa bsal ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang mthong don kho nar log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du rang gis mthong don smos par byas pa yin no /
analyzed: gal te yang tshul gsum pa'i rtags smos pas kyang bshad pa la ltos te log par rtogs pa bsal ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang mthong don kho nar log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du rang gis mthong don smos par byas pa yin no /
translated: Even if the statement of the trimodal logical mark also eliminates misconception in dependence on the explanation, still, the statement of the object of one‚Äôs own perception is made for the purpose of eliminating misconception only with regard to the object of one‚Äôs own perception.

original: @9b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @9b zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //

original: gzhal ba ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal ba ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: The opponent is the one who is to be evaluated.

original: bdag gi rgol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rgol ba'o //

original: gzhan dag gis ni phyir rgol ba dag gis so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni phyir rgol ba dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù are the opponents.

original: kha cig ni grangs can no //
analyzed: kha cig ni grangs can no //
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù are the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs snga ma'i rnam par 'grel ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs snga ma'i rnam par 'grel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù and so on are the commentary on the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: rang gis zhes bya ba rgol bas rtogs pa dbang du bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba rgol bas rtogs pa dbang du bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy oneself‚Äù is not under the control of the opponent‚Äôs understanding.

original: ci'i phyir brjod par mi bya snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir brjod par mi bya snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhy should it not be stated?‚Äù

original: rgol bas rtogs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol bas rtogs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if the opponent understands‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni phyir rgol ba'o //

original: gal te de yod ces bya ba ni phyir rgol rang nyid rtogs par gyur na'o //

translated: At that time, that very understanding by oneself would be the reason here.

translated: What is the use of the opponent‚Äôs understanding? The meaning is that nothing is to be done.

original: 'di ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: This should be stated.

original: 'dir ni rtags la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rtags la'o //
translated: Here it is for the reason.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgol bas so //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgol bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo‚Äù is for the opponent.

original: ngas ni phyir rgol bas so //
analyzed: ngas ni phyir rgol bas so //

original: grub pa'i mtha'i cha rnam par 'grel ba ni bsam de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i cha rnam par 'grel ba ni bsam de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthought‚Äù in the root text refers to the philosophical tenet that is being explained.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif that is so‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs response.

original: rang gis mthong don smos pa ni rang gis mthong par bstan pa'i phyir byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gis mthong don smos pa ni rang gis mthong par bstan pa'i phyir byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhat I have seen‚Äù is used to indicate that the opponent is speaking from his own perspective.

original: ngag thams cad rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa nyid kyis rang kho nas mthong ba zhes nges par bzung ba ni gdon mi za bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ngag thams cad rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa nyid kyis rang kho nas mthong ba zhes nges par bzung ba ni gdon mi za bar bya ba yin no //

translated: Therefore, the opponent is proving only what he himself has seen, not what the other party has seen.

original: de lta na yang lung las grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang lung las grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, the opponent‚Äôs position would be established by scripture.

original: tshad mas grub pa nyid yin na ni gnyi ga la grub par thal ba'i phyir na nges par bzung ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa nyid yin na ni gnyi ga la grub par thal ba'i phyir na nges par bzung ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //

original: des na gzhan gyis mthong ba rnam par bcad pa'i phyir don med pa gzhan zhes bya ba don gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi bkod pa sgrub byed du 'gyur ba thog tu bab po zhe na /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis mthong ba rnam par bcad pa'i phyir don med pa gzhan zhes bya ba don gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi bkod pa sgrub byed du 'gyur ba thog tu bab po zhe na /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the perception of others, the non-existence of an object called ‚Äúother‚Äù is established as the mere arrangement of conceptualization.

original: 'di la lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //

translated: The mention of one‚Äôs own perception does not negate the perception of others.

analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan kho nas mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'gog pa yin no //

analyzed: des na gnyi gas mthong ba yang mi 'gal ba kho na'o //

original: des na rang gis mthong ba smos @10a * //
analyzed: des na rang gis mthong ba smos @10a * //

original: pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni rang gi brjod par bya ba gnyi gas mthong ba nyid rang gzhan kho nas zhes nges par 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ci ltar gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni rang gi brjod par bya ba gnyi gas mthong ba nyid rang gzhan kho nas zhes nges par 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ci ltar gnas pa nyid do //
translated: This definition is just as it is, with the words ‚Äúby both‚Äù and ‚Äúonly by itself and others‚Äù definitely excluding the definition of what is seen by itself.

original: rang gi mthong ba'i sgra ni rang gis mthong ba nyid sgrub par byed pa kho nas nges par 'gog pa shes par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mthong ba'i sgra ni rang gis mthong ba nyid sgrub par byed pa kho nas nges par 'gog pa shes par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúseen‚Äù in ‚Äúseen by itself‚Äù is understood to be a negation, just by the fact that it is a proof of what is seen by itself.

original: des ni zhes bya ba gnyi gas mthong bar bstan pa'i don gyis ni log par rtogs pa lung las gzhan gyis mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin no //
