original: de ni rtags so //
analyzed: de ni rtags so //
translated: This is the reason.

original: gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol bas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol bas so //
translated: The other is the opponent.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba rgol bas rtogs so zhes yongs su shes pa ni phyir rgol ba lam kho na med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba rgol bas rtogs so zhes yongs su shes pa ni phyir rgol ba lam kho na med do //
translated: The other, i.e., the opponent, understands, i.e., knows.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why?

original: phyir rgol ba gzhan la chog pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba gzhan la chog pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
translated: The other, i.e., the opponent, is satisfied.

original: 'o na zhes bya bar rang gis ni rgol bas so //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya bar rang gis ni rgol bas so //
translated: If that is so, then the opponent himself understands, i.e., knows.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba la 'grub pas so //üîΩ'o na gzhan phyir rgol ba la grub pa rtags yin no zhes bya ba la rgol bas yongs su shes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba la 'grub pas so // 'o na gzhan phyir rgol ba la grub pa rtags yin no zhes bya ba la rgol bas yongs su shes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The other, i.e., the opponent, is satisfied.üîΩIf that is so, then the opponent himself is satisfied, i.e., knows.

original: gal te rgol ba la rtags 'di ni phyir rgol bas tshad mas nges pa yin no snyam pa'i nges pa yod pa yin na de'i tshe de rgol bas kyang nges pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te rgol ba la rtags 'di ni phyir rgol bas tshad mas nges pa yin no snyam pa'i nges pa yod pa yin na de'i tshe de rgol bas kyang nges pa kho na ste /
translated: If the opponent has the certainty that this reason is ascertained by valid cognition for the opponent, then at that time the opponent himself has the certainty.

original: gzhan du ni gzhon la grub pas zhes brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni gzhon la grub pas zhes brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be correct to say that the other is satisfied.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i nyes pa yod pa des na rgol pa @10b rang gis ma rtogs par 'di ni gzhan la grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dir ci ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i nyes pa yod pa des na rgol pa @10b rang gis ma rtogs par 'di ni gzhan la grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dir ci ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: Because such faults exist, how could the proponent, without understanding himself, say, ‚ÄúThis is established for the other party‚Äù? It could not be so!

original: gzhan gyis rtags par grub pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag med pas brjod pa ni tshu rol mthong zhes bya ba rgol ba gzhan gyis zhes bya ba phyir rgol ba'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtags par grub pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag med pas brjod pa ni tshu rol mthong zhes bya ba rgol ba gzhan gyis zhes bya ba phyir rgol ba'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: Since there is no direct perception or inference for the other party regarding the establishment of the reason, the statement ‚Äúthe one who sees only one side‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs understanding.

original: rang gis rtogs pa la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis rtogs pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i rtags khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas rgol ba rang gis shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis rtogs pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i rtags khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas rgol ba rang gis shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor one‚Äôs own understanding‚Äù means that in the case of understanding for the other party, the reason and pervasion are established by valid cognition without error. The proponent should understand this himself.

original: de ltar na phyir rgol bas rtogs par rgol bas shes par 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na phyir rgol bas rtogs par rgol bas shes par 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: In that case, the opponent would understand what the proponent knows.

original: des na gzhan gyis rtogs pa shes pa'i rgol ba rang gis kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis rtogs pa shes pa'i rgol ba rang gis kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the proponent who knows what the other party understands would also understand it himself.

original: des na gzhan kho nas mthong ba zhes nges par ci ltar 'gyur de nyid brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na gzhan kho nas mthong ba zhes nges par ci ltar 'gyur de nyid brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, how could it be ascertained that ‚Äúonly the other sees‚Äù?

original: rang gis rtogs pa la ltos pas so //
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa la ltos pas so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthat very thing‚Äù refers to the fact that it depends on one‚Äôs own understanding.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs ba'o zhes nges pa gang yin pa de ni rgol ba rang gis kyang rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs ba'o zhes nges pa gang yin pa de ni rgol ba rang gis kyang rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The ascertainment that ‚Äúthe other understands‚Äù is also the opponent‚Äôs own understanding.

original: nged kyi ltar na ni tshad mas mthong ba'i sgrub par byed pa brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na ni tshad mas mthong ba'i sgrub par byed pa brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: But according to us, there is no fault, because the proof that is seen by valid cognition is to be stated.

original: gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äù is the opponent.

original: rang gis ni rgol bas so //
analyzed: rang gis ni rgol bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù is the proponent.

original: 'o na ci ltar rang gis mthong ba zhes mi brjod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rang gis mthong ba zhes mi brjod snyam na /
translated: If that is so, why not say ‚Äúseen by one‚Äôs own‚Äù?

original: 'on kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes smos so //
translated: But still, it is said.

original: gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very thing‚Äù refers to impermanence, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la lung gi tshig tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa khas len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la lung gi tshig tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa khas len pa ma yin no //
translated: The object of inference is not accepted as the object of a valid scriptural statement, such as impermanence, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yongs brtags yongs su len phyir te //
analyzed: yongs brtags yongs su len phyir te //
translated: Because it is the basis of the investigation and the acceptance of the investigation.

original: khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the acceptance of the investigation.

original: des na lung las gzhan gyi grub brtags yin no zhes ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: des na lung las gzhan gyi grub brtags yin no zhes ci ltar brjod /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that scripture is a means of valid cognition that is other than inference?

original: yang na gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: yang na gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ma yin na /
translated: Or, if you do not accept that the object of inference is a means of valid cognition,

original: 'o na gang du 'dod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang du 'dod snyam na /
translated: then what do you accept?

original: yongs brtags yongs su len phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs brtags yongs su len phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the investigation and the acceptance of the investigation.üîΩWhen the objects of direct perception and inference are pure, then scripture is a means of valid cognition for the investigation of the unobstructed third category that is completely hidden.

original: zhes bya ba ste mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kyis yul rnam par dag par gyur pa na shin tu lkog tu gyur pa phung po gsum pa gnod pa med pa la yongs su brtags pa tshad mar khas len pa'i phyir ni phung po gsum paüîΩla lung tshang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kyis yul rnam par dag par gyur pa na shin tu lkog tu gyur pa phung po gsum pa gnod pa med pa la yongs su brtags pa tshad mar khas len pa'i phyir ni phung po gsum pa la lung tshang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the third category is a means of valid cognition that is different from the other two.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang tshad mar 'dod na de'i tshe skyon ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang tshad mar 'dod na de'i tshe skyon ci yod snyam na /
translated: If you accept that the object of inference is a means of valid cognition, then what is the problem with that?

original: der ni zhes smos te brjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig tshad mar khas len na rjes su dpag pa 'jug par mi 'gyur te /üîΩrtogs @11a * //
analyzed: der ni zhes smos te brjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig tshad mar khas len na rjes su dpag pa 'jug par mi 'gyur te / rtogs @11a * //
translated: Here, if means that if one accepts a statement as a valid cognition with regard to an object of inference, then inference would not operate.

original: zin pa rtogs pa la don med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zin pa rtogs pa la don med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would be pointless for understanding to understand what has already been understood.

original: tshig tsam gyis don grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis don grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning is already established by mere words.

original: bas blangs bas grub pa'i tshad mar bstan pa'i don du gzhi 'ding bar byed pa ni lung de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bas blangs bas grub pa'i tshad mar bstan pa'i don du gzhi 'ding bar byed pa ni lung de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to teach that it is a valid cognition that is accepted, it is said, The basis for that is... and so on.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa dgag pa brjod pa'i phyir phung po gsum pa la tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa dgag pa brjod pa'i phyir phung po gsum pa la tshad ma yin no //
translated: With regard to what is not an object of direct perception or inference, it is a valid cognition with regard to a third category, because the negation is expressed.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul la yang de kho na ltar 'gyur ro snyam na de'i yul la ni zhes smos te mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul la yang de kho na ltar 'gyur ro snyam na de'i yul la ni zhes smos te mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul la'o //
translated: If one thinks that it would be the same with regard to the objects of direct perception and so on, it is said, With regard to their objects, that is, with regard to the objects of direct perception and so on.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phung po gsum ka pa yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phung po gsum ka pa yang ngo //
translated: In every way means that it is also a third category.

original: rjes su dpag pa don med pa nyid gsal bar byed pa nyid 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa don med pa nyid gsal bar byed pa nyid 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the very thing that makes it clear that inference is pointless.

original: der zhes bya ba ni skye ba can nam mi rtag pa la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni skye ba can nam mi rtag pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú There‚Äù means in the case of something that is produced or impermanent.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas ba'i tshig 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas ba'i tshig 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
translated: At that time, not only the Buddhist statement,

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni sems pa med pa yin te zhes bya ba'i grangs can gyi tshig kyang tshad ma yin pa de bas na'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni sems pa med pa yin te zhes bya ba'i grangs can gyi tshig kyang tshad ma yin pa de bas na'o //
translated: but also the SƒÅ·πÉkhya statement, ‚ÄúPleasure and so on are not conscious,‚Äù is valid.

original: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi tshig nyid las so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi tshig nyid las so //
translated: ‚Äú From that alone‚Äù means from the SƒÅ·πÉkhya statement alone.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas ba'i tshig bde ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshad mas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas ba'i tshig bde ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshad mas grub pa yin no //
translated: Impermanence and so on are established by valid knowledge to be the case for pleasure and so on, which are the words of the Buddhist.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tshad mar grub pa bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can yin no zhes zer ba'i sangs rgyas pa'i lung nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tshad mar grub pa bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can yin no zhes zer ba'i sangs rgyas pa'i lung nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚Äú From that alone‚Äù means from the Buddhist scripture that is established by valid knowledge, which states that pleasure and so on are conscious.

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni grangs can pa'i rjes dpag gis phyin ci log sems ba myong bar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni grangs can pa'i rjes dpag gis phyin ci log sems ba myong bar mi 'grub po //
translated: ‚ÄúBy inference‚Äù means that the inference of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not establish the experience of a mistaken mind.

original: de las bzlog ba ni sems pa can las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog ba ni sems pa can las bzlog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe opposite of that‚Äù is the opposite of a mind that has a self.

original: gang zhi tshe lung la gnod pa'i phyir bstan bar bya ba la sgrub par byed pa brjod par rtsom pa de nyid kyi tshe lung de ni tshad ma yin bde bas na lung des grub ba'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs ba ma lus pa ni grub baüîΩma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhi tshe lung la gnod pa'i phyir bstan bar bya ba la sgrub par byed pa brjod par rtsom pa de nyid kyi tshe lung de ni tshad ma yin bde bas na lung des grub ba'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs ba ma lus pa ni grub ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: When one begins to state a proof for what is to be established, in order to refute the opponent‚Äôs scripture, at that very time, that scripture is not a valid means of knowledge. Therefore, all of the impermanence, etc., established by that scripture is not established at all.

original: khas blangs pas zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pas tshad ma'i dngos bos byas pa des na'o //üîΩde zhes bya ba khas blangs pa der na lung de'i tshad ma nyid kyang de bzhin du zhes bya bar dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khas blangs pas zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pas tshad ma'i dngos bos byas pa des na'o // de zhes bya ba khas blangs pa der na lung de'i tshad ma nyid kyang de bzhin du zhes bya bar dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy acceptance‚Äù means by the nature of a valid means of knowledge that is accepted.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the acceptance. If that scripture is a valid means of knowledge, then it is said to be discarded.

original: des rab tu grub ba zhes bya ba lung las grub pa'i gtan tshigs nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rab tu grub ba zhes bya ba lung las grub pa'i gtan tshigs nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished by that‚Äù refers to the loss of the reason established by scripture.

original: gal te gzhan nyams bas gzhan yang nyams so zhes ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyams bas gzhan yang nyams so zhes ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one were to say, ‚ÄúHow can one be ruined by the ruin of another?‚Äù

original: de la zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la zhes smos so //
translated: the reply is, ‚ÄúIn that case.‚Äù

original: khas blangs ba lar glas pa'i bdag @11b nyid tshad ma dang gtan tshigs kyis sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'i lung gang yin pa de ni khas blangs ba de'i rjes su mi 'jug ba ma yin te rjes su 'jug pa
analyzed: khas blangs ba lar glas pa'i bdag @11b nyid tshad ma dang gtan tshigs kyis sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'i lung gang yin pa de ni khas blangs ba de'i rjes su mi 'jug ba ma yin te rjes su 'jug pa
translated: The scripture which has all the characteristics of a scripture, such as being accepted, being the word of a reliable person, and being established by means of a proof statement, etc., is not non-conforming to that acceptance; it is only conforming to it.

original: kho na'o // khas blangs pa nyams pas nyams ba kho nar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kho na'o // khas blangs pa nyams pas nyams ba kho nar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is only ruined by the ruin of the acceptance. This is the meaning.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de la rag las pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de la rag las pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be dependent on that.

original: rtogs par byed pa ni gtan tshigs grub pa la zhes bya ba ste mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa grub pa la sogs pa tshad ma nyid ces bya ba ni bstan par bya ba'i lung zhes bya ba skabs su babs pa yin no
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa ni gtan tshigs grub pa la zhes bya ba ste mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa grub pa la sogs pa tshad ma nyid ces bya ba ni bstan par bya ba'i lung zhes bya ba skabs su babs pa yin no
translated: ‚ÄúThe proof statement‚Äù is the establishment of the proof statement of impermanence, etc. ‚ÄúValidity‚Äù is the scripture which is the subject matter. This is the context.

original: // lan ni de ma yin te zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: // lan ni de ma yin te zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúNo, it is not so.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni sems pa can nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni sems pa can nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSomeone‚Äù means a sentient being.

original: thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù means impermanence, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i tshig gi phyogs gcig po gang yin pa de ni'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i tshig gi phyogs gcig po gang yin pa de ni'o //
translated: The one part of the statement that teaches impermanence, etc.

original: 'on te tshad mas grub kyang pha rol grangs can las pha rol las rab tu grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te tshad mas grub kyang pha rol grangs can las pha rol las rab tu grub pa nyid do //
translated: Even if it is established by a means of valid knowledge, it is established by the opponent, not by oneself.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad ma'i gtsug lag mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i gtsug lag mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of not knowing the treatise on means of valid knowledge.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi gsal bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi gsal bar bya ba ste /
translated: One‚Äôs own characteristic is one‚Äôs own manifestation.

original: tshad ma'i gtsug lag mi shes pa nyid gsal bar byed de ston par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i gtsug lag mi shes pa nyid gsal bar byed de ston par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Not knowing the treatise on means of valid knowledge manifests, i.e., teaches, that.

original: de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi ste rgol bas sgrub par byed pa ma shes kyang nyes pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi ste rgol bas sgrub par byed pa ma shes kyang nyes pa med pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúEven so,‚Äù etc. is the opponent‚Äôs, i.e., the challenger‚Äôs, statement that there is no fault even if the proof is not understood.

original: phyir rgol ba la bsgrub bar bya ba nges pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba la bsgrub bar bya ba nges pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the probandum is ascertained for the opponent.

original: sgrub bar byed pa ma yin pa'i nyes pa yang med do zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub bar byed pa ma yin pa'i nyes pa yang med do zhes smras pa ni /
translated: And there is no fault of non-establishment of the proof.

original: rang la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: phyir rgol ba bdag nyid la grub pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba bdag nyid la grub pa'o //
translated: [The proof] is established for the opponent himself.

original: rgol ba de'i phyir rgol 'di'o //
analyzed: rgol ba de'i phyir rgol 'di'o //
translated: The opponent is the one who is arguing.

original: gzhan du mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags la ma shes pa tsam gyis kun du sems pa med pa nyid la yang mi shes pa ni mi 'os pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags la ma shes pa tsam gyis kun du sems pa med pa nyid la yang mi shes pa ni mi 'os pa kho na'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be appropriate for the mere non-understanding of the reason such as impermanence to be non-understanding of the probandum.

original: rtags ma shes kyang bsgrub par bya ba shes pa ni rgol ba la yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtags ma shes kyang bsgrub par bya ba shes pa ni rgol ba la yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even if the reason is not understood, the probandum is understood by the opponent.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
translated: The latter half is explained as the reason.

original: tshad ma'i gtsug lag ma shes pa'i phyir na ;
analyzed: tshad ma'i gtsug lag ma shes pa'i phyir na ;
translated: Because of not knowing the science of logic,

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrub par nus pa ma yin zhes te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrub par nus pa ma yin zhes te /
translated: impermanence and so on cannot be established as reasons.

original: grangs can te bsgrub par bya ba sems pa med pa nyid bsgrub pa la yang mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grangs can te bsgrub par bya ba sems pa med pa nyid bsgrub pa la yang mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya cannot prove the probandum, the absence of sentience.

original: gal te grangs can la bsgrub bya grub pa med phyir rgol ba la go ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grangs can la bsgrub bya grub pa med phyir rgol ba la go ci ltar zhe na /
translated: If the SƒÅ·πÉkhya has no established probandum, how can the opponent understand?

original: de ni re zhig ces smos te /üîΩrtogs @12a * //
analyzed: de ni re zhig ces smos te / rtogs @12a * //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚ÄùüîΩThe object of understanding is that.

original: par bya ba de ni gtan tshigs de las zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: par bya ba de ni gtan tshigs de las zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa las so //
translated: From that reason, such as impermanence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause of the absence of clarity.

original: pha rol po sangs rgyas ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po sangs rgyas ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs doubt is anticipated: ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

original: grangs can 'di sgo med par te thabs dang bral bar bya nus ba ste /
analyzed: grangs can 'di sgo med par te thabs dang bral bar bya nus ba ste /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya can be refuted without recourse, that is, without means.

original: bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no clarity that is the nature of the proof that is the means of understanding the probandum.

original: de ltar byas pas rgol ba brtan po ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas rgol ba brtan po ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is the case, the opponent is not firm.

original: sun 'byin pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThat is also not so.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni grangs can rgol ba mkhrang po yin pas so //üîΩ'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni grangs can rgol ba mkhrang po yin pas so // 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other is the SƒÅ·πÉkhya opponent who is stubborn.üîΩThis is clarified by in this way.

original: khyod la ste bstan par bya ba la gtan tshigs te grub na'o //
analyzed: khyod la ste bstan par bya ba la gtan tshigs te grub na'o //
translated: The reason is for the one to be instructed, that is, for the one who is convinced.

original: nga grub ces bya ba ni ston par byed pa la grub pas so //
analyzed: nga grub ces bya ba ni ston par byed pa la grub pas so //
translated: The one who is convinced is the one who teaches.

original: 'on te yang gtan tshigs ston par byed ba la ma grub na 'di las bstan par bya bas bsgrub bya ci ltar rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te yang gtan tshigs ston par byed ba la ma grub na 'di las bstan par bya bas bsgrub bya ci ltar rtogs snyam na /
translated: But if the reason is not established for the one who teaches, how can the one to be instructed understand the probandum from this?

original: thams cad dang yis bya ba ste ston par byed bas so //
analyzed: thams cad dang yis bya ba ste ston par byed bas so //
translated: The word all is for the one who teaches.

original: gtan tshigs kyang zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reason is also, that is, impermanence and so on.

original: 'on te gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin bstan bar bya bas mi shus pa nyid yin ba des na de la grub ba'i rtags kyi shes pa ci ste brjod snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin bstan bar bya bas mi shus pa nyid yin ba des na de la grub ba'i rtags kyi shes pa ci ste brjod snyam na /
translated: But if the nature of the reason is not understood by the one to be instructed, then why is the knowledge of the reason established for him stated?

original: thams cad ces smos so //
analyzed: thams cad ces smos so //
translated: The word all is stated.

original: yang sangs rgyas ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Again, anticipating an objection from the Buddhist, he says,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr else‚Äù is the second alternative.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya ba la grub pa'i rtags kyis rtogs par bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya ba la grub pa'i rtags kyis rtogs par bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the probandum, which is to be understood through the logical reason that proves it.

original: gzhan gyi lan ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lan ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response is ‚ÄúThat too.‚Äù

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the following.

original: de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa la lan brjod ba'o //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa la lan brjod ba'o //
translated: The response to the objection that begins with ‚ÄúGranted all that‚Äù is as follows.

original: gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äù refers to the opponent.

original: rgol ba 'dis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs so zhes bya ba'i blor ro //
analyzed: rgol ba 'dis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs so zhes bya ba'i blor ro //
translated: The opponent thinks, ‚ÄúThis argument proves impermanence and so on.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the explanation that follows.

original: bstan par bya ba 'di ston par byed pa ngas so //üîΩ'di zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya ba'o zhes de ltar rtogs ba ci ltar zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba 'di ston par byed pa ngas so // 'di zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya ba'o zhes de ltar rtogs ba ci ltar zhes 'brel te /
translated: ‚ÄúI‚Äù refers to the one who teaches this probandum.

original: de ltar sus ma rtogs pa zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar sus ma rtogs pa zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the probandum. The opponent thinks, ‚ÄúHow is it that I have not understood this?‚Äù

original: rang gis te rgol ba grangs can nyid kyis ma rtogs par ro //
analyzed: rang gis te rgol ba grangs can nyid kyis ma rtogs par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù means that the opponent has not understood it by himself.

original: 'dis ci bya zhes bya ba ni ga zhan gyis rtogs so zhes shes pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ci bya zhes bya ba ni ga zhan gyis rtogs so zhes shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the point of this?‚Äù The opponent thinks, ‚ÄúThe other person has understood it.‚Äù

original: bslus nas kyang zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel ba'i tshig brjod nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: bslus nas kyang zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel ba'i tshig brjod nas kyang ngo //
translated: Having deceived means having uttered a meaningless statement.

original: rgol ba ngas rtogs pas phyir rgol khyed la mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa 'dir dgos pa gzhan ci zhig yod de cung zad kyang med do zhes @12b bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgol ba ngas rtogs pas phyir rgol khyed la mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa 'dir dgos pa gzhan ci zhig yod de cung zad kyang med do zhes @12b bya ba'i don to //
translated: The opponent says, What other purpose do you have in mind for this proof of impermanence? meaning that there is not the slightest purpose.

original: ma rtogs pa ni rtags kyi yul can no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni rtags kyi yul can no //
translated: Not understood is the subject of the reason.

original: ngas zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed ltar snang ba brjod pas so //
analyzed: ngas zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed ltar snang ba brjod pas so //
translated: The word I refers to the expression of a fallacious proof.

original: khyed la phyir rgol ba la'o //üîΩgzhan gyis dogs ba ni ngas kyang zhes bya ba ste phyir rgol bas so //
analyzed: khyed la phyir rgol ba la'o // gzhan gyis dogs ba ni ngas kyang zhes bya ba ste phyir rgol bas so //
translated: The opponent says, To you, meaning to the proponent.üîΩThe opponent says, Even I, meaning the opponent.

original: de ltar ni rgol bltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni rgol bltar ro //
translated: The opponent says, In that case, meaning to the proponent.

original: 'on zhes bya ba ni lan no //üîΩrgol ba la'o //
analyzed: 'on zhes bya ba ni lan no // rgol ba la'o //
translated: The word but is the response.üîΩThe opponent says, To you, meaning to the proponent.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni phyir rgol bas so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni phyir rgol bas so //
translated: The opponent says, It is not to be expressed, meaning by the opponent.

original: 'o na ci zhig brjod par bya zhe na /üîΩ'dir zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig brjod par bya zhe na / 'dir zhes smos te /
translated: What then is to be expressed?

original: rtags 'dir phyir rgol ba'i'o //
analyzed: rtags 'dir phyir rgol ba'i'o //
translated: The opponent says, Here, meaning in this case.üîΩThe opponent says, This reason is yours, meaning the proponent's.

original: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent says, Not understood by the other, meaning by the opponent.

original: 'di la lan ni de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to this is, ‚ÄúIn that case . . . .‚Äù

original: 'dir ni sgrub par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni sgrub par byed pa la'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúin that case‚Äù is in regard to the proof.

original: 'di ltar ni tshul 'dis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ni tshul 'dis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù is by this method.

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni 'a thad pa dang bcas pas mi brjod na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni 'a thad pa dang bcas pas mi brjod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were not so‚Äù is if it were not stated with the reason.

original: 'dir ci ltar ngas zhes bya ba ni rgol bas so //
analyzed: 'dir ci ltar ngas zhes bya ba ni rgol bas so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúhow is it that I . . . ?‚Äù is the opponent.

original: 'on te gzhan la don grub par nges pas ci dgos te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la don grub par nges pas ci dgos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut what is the use of establishing the meaning for others?‚Äù

original: ma shes ba bsgrub ba'i don du rtsom pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: ma shes ba bsgrub ba'i don du rtsom pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: Because it is begun for the purpose of establishing what is not known.

original: gzhan gyi don du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of others‚Äù is stated.

original: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni rgyal bar 'dod pa tsam gyis don du'o //
analyzed: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni rgyal bar 'dod pa tsam gyis don du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that purpose‚Äù is for the purpose of mere desire for victory.

original: 'o na ci ltar gzhan gyis rtogs par nges snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gzhan gyis rtogs par nges snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut how is it certain that others will understand?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù is stated.

original: sgrub par byed pa rang gis rtogs na rgol ba 'dis ni rtags 'di rtogs so zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa rang gis rtogs na rgol ba 'dis ni rtags 'di rtogs so zhes bya bar ro //
translated: If the proof is understood by oneself, then this opponent understands this reason.

original: ma rtogs par bstan na nyes pa ci yod snyam na 'dis zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rtogs par bstan na nyes pa ci yod snyam na 'dis zhes gsungs te /
translated: If it is shown that it is not understood, what is the fault? ‚ÄúBy this‚Äù is stated.

original: grangs can gyis sgrub par byed pa gang la rtogs pa med pa ste brjod ba ni brdzun nyid yin no //
analyzed: grangs can gyis sgrub par byed pa gang la rtogs pa med pa ste brjod ba ni brdzun nyid yin no //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya says: ‚ÄúThe proof that is not understood, that is, that is not stated, is false.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar na yang sten par byed pa nyid las ni ma nyams so snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang sten par byed pa nyid las ni ma nyams so snyam na /
translated: But even if that is so, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya thinks, ‚Äúthe proof is not undermined.‚Äù

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù refers to the opponent.

original: rgol ba rang nyid kyi rtags kyi yul can gyi rtogs pa gang yin ba de med bar ni rgol ba ston bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgol ba rang nyid kyi rtags kyi yul can gyi rtogs pa gang yin ba de med bar ni rgol ba ston bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the opponent does not have the understanding that is the object of the reason, then the opponent will not be taught the proof.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: gal te gzhan phyir rgol ba sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs par khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan phyir rgol ba sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs par khas mi len na'o //
translated: If the opponent does not accept the understanding of the nature of the proof.

original: res 'ga' khas len par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: res 'ga' khas len par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But sometimes the opponent will accept it, you say.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù refers to the opponent.

original: rgol bas sgrub par byed ba'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs na ni nyes pa med do zhes ston pa ni rang nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgol bas sgrub par byed ba'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs na ni nyes pa med do zhes ston pa ni rang nyid ces bya'o //
translated: If the opponent understands the nature of the proof, there is no fault. This is what is shown by ‚Äúone‚Äôs own.‚Äù

original: phyir rgol ba khas len kyang mi bden ba smra ba nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba khas len kyang mi bden ba smra ba nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the opponent does accept the reason, he will realize that the proponent is speaking falsely.üîΩTherefore, in order to avoid speaking falsely, the proponent must accept the proof established by the valid cognition presented by the opponent.

original: des na mi bden pa smra ba spang ba'i phyir rgol bas nye bar bkod pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis khas blang bar bya ba kho na'o //üîΩdes na rang gis rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni gzhan gyis @13a * //
analyzed: des na mi bden pa smra ba spang ba'i phyir rgol bas nye bar bkod pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis khas blang bar bya ba kho na'o // des na rang gis rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni gzhan gyis @13a * //
translated: Thus, it is possible to know that the proof understood by the proponent is understood by the other, but not otherwise.üîΩThe opponent says, ‚ÄúHow can you know that the proponent understands the reason, even though the opponent does not understand it?‚Äù

original: rtogs so zhes shes par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩ'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: rtogs so zhes shes par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis te /
translated: The proponent replies, ‚ÄúI can know it because I understand the proof by means of my own valid cognition, even though others do not understand it.‚Äù

original: rgol bas sgrub par byed pa rang gis rtogs kyang gzhan phyir rgol ba rtags rtogs so zhes ci ltar shes /
analyzed: rgol bas sgrub par byed pa rang gis rtogs kyang gzhan phyir rgol ba rtags rtogs so zhes ci ltar shes /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIf the proponent understands the proof by means of his own valid cognition, then the opponent does not understand it. Therefore, how can you know that the proponent understands the reason?‚Äù

original: rang gi tshad mas rtogs pa la yang gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi tshad mas rtogs pa la yang gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The proponent replies, ‚ÄúEven though I understand the proof by means of my own valid cognition, I see that others do not understand it.‚Äù

original: 'on te phyir rgol bsam rtogs na rgol ba rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te phyir rgol bsam rtogs na rgol ba rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIf the opponent understands the proof, then the proponent does not cause the opponent to understand it.‚Äù

original: gal te phyir rgol bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúNo, it is not established,‚Äù

original: nges zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol gyis so //
analyzed: nges zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol gyis so //
translated: ‚Äúthen‚Äù means ‚Äúif the opponent says.‚Äù

original: de la ni phyir rgol ba rtogs ba bskyed pa'i tshogs ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ni phyir rgol ba rtogs ba bskyed pa'i tshogs ba med pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the opponent does not have the requisite understanding.

original: gal te phyir rgol ba la brjod par don med par gyur pa'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i nyes pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol ba la brjod par don med par gyur pa'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i nyes pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: If you think that the fault of not being a proof is the only fault, because it is meaningless to state it to the opponent,

original: rgol ba'i nyes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgol ba'i nyes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe fault of the proponent is not a fault of the proof.‚Äù

original: der zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba dmus yong du gyur bar ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba dmus yong du gyur bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means ‚Äúif the opponent is blind.‚Äù

original: nyes ba ni rtogs par byed ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyes ba ni rtogs par byed ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúFault‚Äù means the characteristic of not being a proof.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po rnams rtogs pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po rnams rtogs pa tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that alone‚Äù means ‚Äúby the mere understanding of the listeners.‚Äù

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba nas gsal ba nyid ces bya ba'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba nas gsal ba nyid ces bya ba'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand‚Äù up to ‚Äúclarity‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs objection.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa'i rgol bas ni tshogs pa 'ba' zhig rtogs bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa'i rgol bas ni tshogs pa 'ba' zhig rtogs bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: A proponent who has compassion does not cause the mere assembly to understand,

original: 'on kyang phyir rgol ba yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyir rgol ba yang yin no //
translated: but rather the opponent as well.

original: 'o na ci zhig 'dod pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig 'dod pa yin snyam na /
translated: What is it that is wanted?

original: de dag ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes smos so //
translated: The answer is But they...

original: 'di nyid sabs  dang sbyor bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid sabs  dang sbyor bar byed pa ni //
translated: The present is connected with the past by therefore.

original: phyir rgol bas rtogs bar bya ba'i zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnyan pa po nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /üîΩgnyis las gang rung gi phyogs su lhung ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyir rgol bas rtogs bar bya ba'i zhes bya ba'o // nyan pa po nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te / gnyis las gang rung gi phyogs su lhung ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The object of the opponent's understanding is the thesis.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnyan pa po rnams phyogs su lhung bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o // nyan pa po rnams phyogs su lhung bar gyur pa na /
translated: The hearer himself does not exist, because he falls into one of the two positions. The statement of this is Moreover...

original: rgol pa'am phyir rgol ba gcig tu 'gyur ro //üîΩde la phyir rgol bar gyur pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rgol pa'am phyir rgol ba gcig tu 'gyur ro // de la phyir rgol bar gyur pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni /
translated: The hearer falls into a position, and then he becomes either proponent or opponent.üîΩ The statement of the position of the opponent is That position...

original: de phyogs zhes bya ba ste phyir rgol ba de'i phyogs su lhung ba des nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de phyogs zhes bya ba ste phyir rgol ba de'i phyogs su lhung ba des nyams pa'o //
translated: The hearer is damaged by falling into that position of the opponent.

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol gyi phyogs kyis nyams ba'i nyan pa po la yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol gyi phyogs kyis nyams ba'i nyan pa po la yang ngo //
translated: The statement of the damage to the hearer by the position of the opponent is There too...

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi skyon snyam na /
translated: If you think That is so, but it is not a fault,

original: nyan pa po phyir rgol zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: nyan pa po phyir rgol zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: the hearer is called opponent.

original: / nyan pa po dang po phyir rgol gyi phyogs kyis nyams pa'i phyir phyir rgol bar gyur ba na nyan pa po dang po las nyan pa po gzhan du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: / nyan pa po dang po phyir rgol gyi phyogs kyis nyams pa'i phyir phyir rgol bar gyur ba na nyan pa po dang po las nyan pa po gzhan du gyur pa ni /
translated: The second hearer, who is different from the first hearer,

original: nyan po gzhan te der yo bas thug ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan po gzhan te der yo bas thug ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the other hearer. Thus, there would be an infinite regress.

original: rgol ba nyan pa po gnyis pa la rtsod pa byed pan phyir rgol pa nyid du 'gyur gyi nyan pa bo ni ma @13b yin la /
analyzed: rgol ba nyan pa po gnyis pa la rtsod pa byed pan phyir rgol pa nyid du 'gyur gyi nyan pa bo ni ma @13b yin la /
translated: When the second hearer argues with the first opponent, he becomes the opponent, not the hearer.

original: de bzhin du gsum pa la sogs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum pa la sogs pa yang yin te /
translated: Similarly, the third and so on are also like that.

original: de ltar 'ga' yang nyan pa po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩrgol bar gyur pa'i phyogs bsal ba'i don du yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'ga' yang nyan pa po nyid du mi 'gyur ro // rgol bar gyur pa'i phyogs bsal ba'i don du yang brjod pa ni /

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement Or, if you say that... is for the purpose of refuting the position of the opponent.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs su lhung yang gnyis las gcig pu phyogs su lhung ba ni nyan pa po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs su lhung yang gnyis las gcig pu phyogs su lhung ba ni nyan pa po nyid ma yin no //

original: chags pa las gyur te gnyis las gcig gis phyogs su lhung ba na yang rig pas 'thad pa'i phyogs la yang yid gtod par mi 'gyur ba des na ci ltar tshogs yin /
analyzed: chags pa las gyur te gnyis las gcig gis phyogs su lhung ba na yang rig pas 'thad pa'i phyogs la yang yid gtod par mi 'gyur ba des na ci ltar tshogs yin /

original: de'i phyir nyan pa bo ni med ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan pa bo ni med ba kho na'o //

original: de'i phyir na nyan par byed pa dag gis rtogs pa nyid do zhes ci ltar rtogs par byed snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na nyan par byed pa dag gis rtogs pa nyid do zhes ci ltar rtogs par byed snyam na /

original: rtsod pa gnyis pa 'di la lan rim gyis brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa gnyis pa 'di la lan rim gyis brjod pa ni /

analyzed: 'di gzhan gyis don byed do zhes bya bar brjod pa ni skal ba yod pa la yin no //

original: des na gzhan gyi don byed pa zhes bya ba 'di skal med la yang de lta'am zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid yin nam ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don byed pa zhes bya ba 'di skal med la yang de lta'am zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid yin nam ma yin pa kho na'o //

original: de ltan 'o na snying rje can ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de ltan 'o na snying rje can ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then the compassionate one would not exist.

original: nus pas zhes bya ba ste nus pa med pas gzhan gyi don ma byas kyang 'di snying rje'am bdag nyid can ma yin par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pas zhes bya ba ste nus pa med pas gzhan gyi don ma byas kyang 'di snying rje'am bdag nyid can ma yin par ni mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ni snying rje dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni snying rje dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: nyan pa po srid bar brjod pa ni nyan pa po rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyan pa po srid bar brjod pa ni nyan pa po rnams zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de ltar yin dang nyan pa po mi srid par 'gyur ro snyam na thams cad ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: rtsod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan gnyis pa brjod pa ni /

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa rnams so //

original: gang gi phyir de ltar nyan pa po yod pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar nyan pa po yod pa de'i phyir ro //

original: ma zin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lung yin nam /
analyzed: ma zin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lung yin nam /

original: smrang rgyas pa la rjes su mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smrang rgyas pa la rjes su mi brjod pa'o //

original: sogs pa'i sgras na tshigs dor la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras na tshigs dor la sogs pa bsdu'o //

original: phyir rgol ba rtogs pa la yang nus pa nyams pa ma yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas ston pa ni /üîΩde'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba rtogs pa la yang nus pa nyams pa ma yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas ston pa ni / de'i phyir zhes bya'o //

original: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //

original: lung las grub pa nyid yin gyis tshad mas grub pa ni gzhan la grub pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lung las grub pa nyid yin gyis tshad mas grub pa ni gzhan la grub pa ma yin pa'o //

original: tshad mas grub pa ma yin pas ni gzhan yang rtogs pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa ma yin pas ni gzhan yang rtogs pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //

original: gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol gyis so //

original: de la rab tu grub pa ni lung las rab tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu grub pa ni lung las rab tu grub pa'o //

original: @14a * // lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @14a * // lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚Äúnot.

original: phyogs gcig gnod par gyur pa can gyi lung ni'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gnod par gyur pa can gyi lung ni'o //

original: bde ba la sogs pa sems pa yod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lung gi ni /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sems pa yod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lung gi ni /
translated: The scripture of the Buddha, who has the thought of existing pleasure, etc.

original: grangs can gyi rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs can gyi rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: , is impaired by the inference of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: gal te lung de dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas pa la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa grub pa yin na de'i tshe gang gi lung gang yin /
analyzed: gal te lung de dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas pa la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa grub pa yin na de'i tshe gang gi lung gang yin /
translated: If the proponent of momentariness has established the proof of impermanence and so on for the Buddhist who possesses that scripture, then whose scripture is it?

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pas so //

original: lung de dang ldan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: lung de dang ldan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'o //

original: de'i tshe grangs can yang lung de dang ldan pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe grangs can yang lung de dang ldan pa yin pas /
translated: At that time, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya also possesses that scripture.

original: mi rtags pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni gnyi ga la grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtags pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni gnyi ga la grub pa yin no //

original: ci ste grangs can gyis sangs rgyas pa'i lung khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba gnyi ga la grub pa nyid ma yin na de'i tshe 'ga' yang zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa yang /
analyzed: ci ste grangs can gyis sangs rgyas pa'i lung khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba gnyi ga la grub pa nyid ma yin na de'i tshe 'ga' yang zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa yang /
translated: But if the SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not accept the Buddhist scripture, then it is not the case that it is established for both in that way. At that time, the Buddhist also

original: lung de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i lung dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lung de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i lung dang ldan pa ma yin te /

original: de bas na 'ga' la yang sgrub par byed pa ma grub po //
analyzed: de bas na 'ga' la yang sgrub par byed pa ma grub po //

original: des na ni ltar gzhan la grub pa'i rtags kyis gzhan nyid rtogs par byed ces brjod /
analyzed: des na ni ltar gzhan la grub pa'i rtags kyis gzhan nyid rtogs par byed ces brjod /

analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //

original: tshad ma ltar snang ba'i lung las sgrub par byed pa rtogs par las len na ni sangs rgyas pa de rmongs pa nyid yin pas rgol ba grangs can de gzhan sangs rgyas pa'i rmongs pa de ma bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ltar snang ba'i lung las sgrub par byed pa rtogs par las len na ni sangs rgyas pa de rmongs pa nyid yin pas rgol ba grangs can de gzhan sangs rgyas pa'i rmongs pa de ma bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one were to accept a proof from scripture that appears to be a valid means of knowledge, then the Buddhist would be confused, because the opponent, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, would not have refuted the other‚Äôs confusion.

original: 'on te phyir rgol rmongs pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te phyir rgol rmongs pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that the opponent is not confused,

analyzed: lung tshad ma ltar snang ba mi shes ba'i phyir rgol gzhan ci ltar rmongs pa ma yin te rmongs pa kho na'o //
translated: how could the other opponent, who does not understand a scripture that appears to be a valid means of knowledge, not be confused? He would be confused.

original: gal te mi bden pa nyid la rmongs na yang nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te mi bden pa nyid la rmongs na yang nges pa ma yin te /
translated: If one is confused about what is not true, it is not certain.

original: des na de las grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa las phyir rgol bas bsgrub bya 'grub bo snyam na /
analyzed: des na de las grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa las phyir rgol bas bsgrub bya 'grub bo snyam na /

original: mi shes pa yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi shes pa yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is not that they are not known.

original: 'on kyang sangs rgyas pas mi bden pa nyid du nges pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang sangs rgyas pas mi bden pa nyid du nges pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the Buddhists are certain that they are not true.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i lung gis bsgrubs pa'i sems pa can dang 'gal ba sems pa med pa nyid de khas len pa lung de nyid kyis sangs rgyas bde ci ltar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i lung gis bsgrubs pa'i sems pa can dang 'gal ba sems pa med pa nyid de khas len pa lung de nyid kyis sangs rgyas bde ci ltar 'gyur gyi /
