original: gal te de bden pa ma yin pa nyid du mi shes na'o //
analyzed: gal te de bden pa ma yin pa nyid du mi shes na'o //
translated: If one does not know that it is not true.

original: 'on te de dang 'gal ba'i don khas len pa @14b yang tshad ma nyid yin no zhen /
analyzed: 'on te de dang 'gal ba'i don khas len pa @14b yang tshad ma nyid yin no zhen /
translated: But if one accepts a meaning that contradicts that, that also is valid cognition.

original: de dang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de dang zhes gsungs te /
translated: In that case,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i lung gis bsgrubs pa'i sems pa yod ba dang 'gal ba sems pa med pa nyid khas len na de ci ltar tshad ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i lung gis bsgrubs pa'i sems pa yod ba dang 'gal ba sems pa med pa nyid khas len na de ci ltar tshad ma yin /
translated: if one accepts the non-existence of mind, which contradicts the existence of mind established by the Buddhist scriptures, how can that be valid cognition?

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ba'o //
translated: This refers to the Buddhists.

original: de med bar mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa nyid du rtog pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med bar mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa nyid du rtog pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not occur without that.

original: 'di snyam na sangs rgyas pa rmongs pa yin pa des na brjod ma thag pa'i nyes pa med do snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam na sangs rgyas pa rmongs pa yin pa des na brjod ma thag pa'i nyes pa med do snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúThe Buddhist is confused, so the fault just mentioned does not apply,‚Äù

original: sun 'byin pa ni rmongs na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni rmongs na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the refutation is, ‚ÄúIf one is confused . . .‚Äù

original: phyir rgol ba rmongs na ni rgol ba ston bar byed pa ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba rmongs na ni rgol ba ston bar byed pa ma yin no zhes so //
translated: If the opponent is confused, he does not set forth the argument.

original: gzhan gyi rmongs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rmongs pa zhes smos so //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs confusion is mentioned.

original: de ni sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: That is the Buddhist.

original: bzlog pa ni bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can du khas blangs pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can du khas blangs pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The opposite is the opposite of the assertion that pleasure and so on are conscious.

original: de ltar byas pas rgol ba grangs can gyi 'bras bu 'grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas rgol ba grangs can gyi 'bras bu 'grub bo //
translated: When that is done, the argument of the opponent, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, is established.

original: des na rgol ba ni ston par byed pa kho na'o zhes bya bar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: des na rgol ba ni ston par byed pa kho na'o zhes bya bar bsam pa'o //
translated: Therefore the thought is that the opponent is only setting forth the argument.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIt is not . . .‚Äù

original: 'o na gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut when . . .‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs.

original: lan ni nyan pa bo zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gi tshe zhen skal ldan yang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni nyan pa bo zhes bya ba'o // gang gi tshe zhen skal ldan yang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThe listener.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú If the listener is fortunate‚Äù means ‚Äúif the listener is fortunate.‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù is a dispute.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Such‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving the characteristics of permanence, etc.‚Äù

original: de yang ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the opponent.

original: gal te gang zhig sun 'byin pa 'brel med brjod par 'gyur ba de la sgrub par byed pa yang 'brel med kho na brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gang zhig sun 'byin pa 'brel med brjod par 'gyur ba de la sgrub par byed pa yang 'brel med kho na brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: If someone says that the refutation is irrelevant, then the proof should also be said to be irrelevant. Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smras so //
translated: ‚Äú It is like this‚Äù is the answer.

original: tshong ba dang rin ci 'dra ba de dang 'tsham pa'i phur ma 'ching gis mi 'tsham par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshong ba dang rin ci 'dra ba de dang 'tsham pa'i phur ma 'ching gis mi 'tsham par ni ma yin no //
translated: The price of the goods is like the price. The knot of the bundle is appropriate, not inappropriate.

original: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa yang gzhan gyis sun 'byin pa ci 'dra ba brjod par bya ba de 'dra ba kho na brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa yang gzhan gyis sun 'byin pa ci 'dra ba brjod par bya ba de 'dra ba kho na brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the proof should be said to be like the refutation expressed by the other.

original: lan ni 'di glen pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di glen pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThis is foolish.‚Äù

original: nga'i slong phor du 'dis chang 'thungs so zhes bya ba 'di dang ni bdag la 'dis ma 'brel ba'i sun 'byin pa brjod do zhes bya ba 'dis mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: nga'i slong phor du 'dis chang 'thungs so zhes bya ba 'di dang ni bdag la 'dis ma 'brel ba'i sun 'byin pa brjod do zhes bya ba 'dis mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: The statement this man drank wine in my begging bowl is similar to the statement this man is not related to me, and the statement I will drink urine in his begging bowl is similar to the statement I will make an unrelated refutation to him.

original: bdag gis de'i slong bar du gcin btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di dang mtshungs pa ni bdag gis 'di la sgrub par byed pa ma 'brel par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis de'i slong bar du gcin btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di dang mtshungs pa ni bdag gis 'di la sgrub par byed pa ma 'brel par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The opponent says, The refutation is not related to the probandum, but the statement I will make an unrelated refutation to him is similar to the statement I will drink urine in his begging bowl.

original: rgol bas ni gzhan gyi rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgol bas ni gzhan gyi rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The opponent is one who should dispel the confusion of others.

original: 'di ni gnyi ga la yang long ba dang 'dra bas rgol phyir rgol gyi ming mi 'thob bo @15a * //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyi ga la yang long ba dang 'dra bas rgol phyir rgol gyi ming mi 'thob bo @15a * //
translated: Since both are like the blind, neither the proponent nor the opponent obtains the name.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: don de zhes bya ba ni sems med pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: don de zhes bya ba ni sems med pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is the proof of the meaning of the absence of mind.

original: de zhes bya ba rang la bsgrub pa'i sgrub bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba rang la bsgrub pa'i sgrub bar byed pa'o //
translated: That is the proof of the probandum for oneself.

original: rang nyid la rab tu grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang nyid la rab tu grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Fully established for oneself is the meaning of the proof.

original: rang gis bsgrub bar bya ba sems pa med pa nyid rab tu grub pa ste /
analyzed: rang gis bsgrub bar bya ba sems pa med pa nyid rab tu grub pa ste /
translated: The absence of thought, which is to be established by oneself, is well established.

original: nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: It is established by the reason.

original: 'di nyid rab tu grub pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid rab tu grub pa ni /
translated: This very establishment is

original: gtan tshigs gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: called the clarification of the reason.

original: dga' bar byed pa'i ngal ba ni gzhan la grub pa sgrub byed du 'god pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa'i ngal ba ni gzhan la grub pa sgrub byed du 'god pa'o //
translated: The toil of delighting is setting forth the establishment of what is established for the other.

original: gzhan gyis grangs can la zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis grangs can la zhes smras so //
translated: The other says to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya:

original: de zhes bya ba sems pa med pa ni grangs can gyi lung las so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba sems pa med pa ni grangs can gyi lung las so //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúthat‚Äù is the absence of thought, according to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya scriptures.

original: lan ni lung de nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: lan ni lung de nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The reply is that very scripture.

original: de nyid ni grangs can gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni grangs can gyi'o //
translated: That very scripture is the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs.

original: gzhan la yang ni sangs rgyas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang ni sangs rgyas pa la yang ngo //
translated: The other is the Buddhist.

original: sgrub par byed pa nyid ni sems pa med pa'i 'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nyid ni sems pa med pa'i 'o //
translated: The establishment is of the absence of thought.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is said by the other.

original: gzhan la ni sangs rgyas pa las so //
analyzed: gzhan la ni sangs rgyas pa las so //
translated: The other is the Buddhist.

original: lan ni tshad ma ma yin pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni tshad ma ma yin pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is ‚Äúwith regard to the invalid.‚Äù

original: de la zhes pa ni gzhan gyis grangs can la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni gzhan gyis grangs can la'o //
translated: There, the other says to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya:

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIf you say that. ‚Äù

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Everything‚Äù means

original: sangs rgyas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la yang ngo //
translated: even the Buddhist.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes smos so //
translated: The other‚Äôs assertion is stated.

original: lan ni grangs can yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni grangs can yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThe SƒÅ·πÉkhya also. ‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis des zhes smras te grangs can gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis des zhes smras te grangs can gyis so //
translated: The other says, ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIf you say that. ‚Äù

original: gzhan zhes bya bas sangs rgyas pa la yang khas blangs pa nyid 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya bas sangs rgyas pa la yang khas blangs pa nyid 'gyur ro //
translated: The other means the Buddhist also would have an assertion.

original: 'dis kyang ni sangs rgyas pas so //
analyzed: 'dis kyang ni sangs rgyas pas so //
translated: This also is the Buddhist.

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni sangs rgyas pa de rigs pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni sangs rgyas pa de rigs pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The anticipation of an objection is ‚ÄúBecause the Buddhist does not accept the reasoning. ‚Äù

original: lan de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIn that case. ‚Äù

original: gal te lung 'dzin pa'i rigs pa khas mi len na ;
analyzed: gal te lung 'dzin pa'i rigs pa khas mi len na ;
translated: If you do not accept the reasoning that holds the scriptures,

original: de'i tshe mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyir sems pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa yang ci ltar khas len /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyir sems pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa yang ci ltar khas len /
translated: then how could you accept the reasoning that consciousness is not permanent and so on?

original: 'on te mi rtag pa'i phyir sems pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pas thob pa yin gyi lung ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa'i phyir sems pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pas thob pa yin gyi lung ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is established by reasoning that the self is not conscious because it is impermanent,

original: rigs pa las zhes smos so //
analyzed: rigs pa las zhes smos so //
translated: then the response is, ‚ÄúFrom reasoning.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar sangs rgyas pas grangs can gyi bstan bcos khas blangs par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sangs rgyas pas grangs can gyi bstan bcos khas blangs par 'gyur mod /
translated: If it is so, then the Buddhist accepts the SƒÅ·πÉkhya treatise.

original: de lta na yang ci 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci 'grub snyam na /
translated: But if that is so, what is established?

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIf that is so.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos khas blangs par gyur na gnyi ga la grub pa lung gi mtshan nyid sems pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa srid pa na lung gi mtshan nyid kyis sgrub @15b par byed pa las gzhan gang yin pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de nye
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs par gyur na gnyi ga la grub pa lung gi mtshan nyid sems pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa srid pa na lung gi mtshan nyid kyis sgrub @15b par byed pa las gzhan gang yin pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de nye
translated: If the treatise is accepted, then since the proof of the absence of consciousness, which is established for both parties, is a characteristic of scripture, then any other proof of impermanence and so on, which is a characteristic of scripture,

original: bar 'god pa ni 'ga' yang bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bar 'god pa ni 'ga' yang bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: is not at all to be adduced.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The response ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù is that of the opponent.

original: sems pa med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ni rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya ba yin gyi rig pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ni rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya ba yin gyi rig pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the yogi/ni realizes the characteristics of the absence of mind, etc., but not through reasoning,

original: lan ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the reply is ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: gzhan sangs rgyas pas kyang rang gis bsgrub par bya ba bde ba la sogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la brjod par nus so //
analyzed: gzhan sangs rgyas pas kyang rang gis bsgrub par bya ba bde ba la sogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la brjod par nus so //
translated: Even the Buddhist can express the characteristics of the absence of pleasure, etc., which are to be established by themselves.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas pa la rang gi rnal 'byor pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma med do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas pa la rang gi rnal 'byor pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma med do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the Buddhist has no valid cognition whose object is the yogi/ni‚Äôs own object,

original: de'i zhes gsung so //
analyzed: de'i zhes gsung so //
translated: the reply is ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: sngar tha mal par gyur pa la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma gang dag gis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thabs rtogs pa dang / de nan tan du byas pa las dngos bo ma lus pa mngon du byed pa'i ye shes skyed par byed pa'i dbang bo'am /
analyzed: sngar tha mal par gyur pa la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma gang dag gis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thabs rtogs pa dang / de nan tan du byas pa las dngos bo ma lus pa mngon du byed pa'i ye shes skyed par byed pa'i dbang bo'am /
translated: The valid cognitions that establish the ordinary person previously realize the method whose characteristic is the cultivation of impermanence, etc., and from the practice of that, the sense faculty that generates the intuition that manifests all things is produced.

original: yang na don de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mngon sum nyid dbang po yin te /
analyzed: yang na don de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mngon sum nyid dbang po yin te /
translated: Or else, the sense faculty is the direct perception itself, by virtue of its nature of realizing that object.

original: de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma de dag ni /
translated: The valid knowledge that establishes the arising of those

original: sangs rgyas pa de'i don nus te skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thabs su gyur pa'i don gyi nus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa de'i don nus te skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thabs su gyur pa'i don gyi nus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: is the capacity of the object of that Buddhist, which is the capacity of the object that is the method of the definition of the meditation on momentariness and so on.

original: gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa skye ba'i yul can de shes par gyur ba na /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa skye ba'i yul can de shes par gyur ba na /
translated: When the object that is the cause of the arising of the consciousness that is the clear appearance of that object is known,

original: de'i rnal 'byor pas rtogs pa'i yul gyi don khas len par nus pa la yin te mthu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnal 'byor pas rtogs pa'i yul gyi don khas len par nus pa la yin te mthu yod pa yin no //
translated: the yogi is able to accept the object that is the object of realization.

original: tshad mas mthong ba'i don mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa la ni sangs rgyas pa'i tshad ma yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba'i don mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa la ni sangs rgyas pa'i tshad ma yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning is that the yogi who has the characteristic of actualizing the object seen by valid knowledge definitely has the valid knowledge of a Buddhist.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúNaturally established‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa da  kho na bsgom pa la mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa da  kho na bsgom pa la mi ltos pa'o //
translated: means not relying on the meditation on impermanence.

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i thabs rtogs pa ni rnal 'byor pa sgrub par byed pa'i thabs rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i thabs rtogs pa ni rnal 'byor pa sgrub par byed pa'i thabs rtogs pa'o //
translated: The means of realizing that is the means of realizing the yoga of the practitioner.

original: don de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu brtags nas brjod par blta'o //
analyzed: don de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu brtags nas brjod par blta'o //
translated: The nature of realizing that object is called ‚Äúdirect perception,‚Äù and it should be understood that the effect is figuratively designated to the cause.

original: dngos kyi don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos kyi don brjod pa ni /
translated: The actual meaning is stated:

original: yang na dbang bo nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang bo nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or it is the faculty itself.

original: rtogs pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa de dag ni de'i rnal 'byor pas rtogs pa'i don khas len par bya ba la nus pa nyid do zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: rtogs pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa de dag ni de'i rnal 'byor pas rtogs pa'i don khas len par bya ba la nus pa nyid do zhes 'brel te /
translated: Those means of realizing, etc., are just capable of accepting the object realized by the yogi.

original: ci ltar gyur pa na zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar gyur pa na zhe na /
translated: What is the case?

original: thabs su gyur pa'i don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: thabs su gyur pa'i don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with ‚Äúthe means of the object, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa @16a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa @16a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa ste nye bar dgod pas ci zhig bya ste ci yang byar med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa ste nye bar dgod pas ci zhig bya ste ci yang byar med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, what is the use of the means of realizing impermanence, etc.? It is that nothing is to be done.

original: 'o na ci ltar brjod par rigs snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar brjod par rigs snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow is it proper to express it?‚Äù

original: ci ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIn what way?‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang sngar sems pa med pa la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa gang gis 'dis rtogs par gyur pa de nyid kyis gzhan la yang bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang sngar sems pa med pa la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa gang gis 'dis rtogs par gyur pa de nyid kyis gzhan la yang bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If that is the case, then whatever proves the probandum, such as the absence of consciousness, etc., by which this is understood, that very thing proves the other also.

original: de lta na yang grangs can gyis ma brjod de des na sgrub par byed pa de ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang grangs can gyis ma brjod de des na sgrub par byed pa de ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Even so, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not state it, and therefore that proof is not possible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'on te zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'on te zhes gsungs te //
translated: It is precisely because of that that ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand‚Äù is stated.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa ni sems pa med pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa ni sems pa med pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The proof of that is the proof of the absence of consciousness, etc.

original: 'dir ni sems pa med pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni sems pa med pa nyid la'o //
translated: Here, it is in regard to the absence of consciousness.

original: rjes 'gro rnam chad can zhes bya ba ni dpe la rjes su 'gro ba des pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rjes 'gro rnam chad can zhes bya ba ni dpe la rjes su 'gro ba des pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving a discontinuous pervasion‚Äù means that the example does not have a continuous pervasion.

original: don gang zhig sgrub par byed pas rjes su rtogs par nus pa de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa sems pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: don gang zhig sgrub par byed pas rjes su rtogs par nus pa de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa sems pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The meaning is this: that which is capable of being understood by the proof is the probandum, and that which is capable of proving is the probans.

original: ci ltar rjes su rtogs snyan na spyi nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar rjes su rtogs snyan na spyi nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it understood? By the universal itself, it is said.

original: don 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sems pa med pa nyid la sems pa'o //
analyzed: don 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sems pa med pa nyid la sems pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning: the thought is that the probandum is not nonexistent.

original: lung gcig pus rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don dang 'bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gcig pus rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don dang 'bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it to be understood by scripture alone, because it is not separate from the meaning of the universal.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyis na rtag par bya ba ma yin pa la tshad ma 'jug par bya ba'i grangs can gyi'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyis na rtag par bya ba ma yin pa la tshad ma 'jug par bya ba'i grangs can gyi'o //
translated: In that case, it is not to be established by the universal and the particular, because the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs engagement of valid knowledge is for the sake of establishing permanence.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i bsam pa'o //
translated: That is, the thought of the person.

original: don yod ces bya ba ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don yod ces bya ba ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The existent is the characteristic of the reason.

original: med pa ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: med pa ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nonexistent is the characteristic of impermanence, etc.

original: sgrub byed ni sems pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub byed ni sems pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The probandum is nonexistence, etc.

original: gal te sems pa med pa yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sems pa med pa yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But if non-cognition exists, then why is it that cognition does not arise from what is not a cause?

original: des na sgrub par byed pa med pa las kyang skye ste shes pa la skyon ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pa med pa las kyang skye ste shes pa la skyon ci yod snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhat is the fault in cognition arising from what is not a cause?‚Äù

original: bshad pa / sems pa can ma yin pa nyid yod kyang rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: bshad pa / sems pa can ma yin pa nyid yod kyang rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: We reply: Even if non-cognition exists, it is the same as non-cognition.

original: rtogs pa ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs pa ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a semblance of cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis phyir dngos po ste rtags dang 'brel med de 'brel pa med pa'i ste dngos por gyur pa'i rtags med par skyes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis phyir dngos po ste rtags dang 'brel med de 'brel pa med pa'i ste dngos por gyur pa'i rtags med par skyes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the thing, that is, the sign, is unrelated, that is, it is without a relation to the sign that is a thing, and it is produced without a sign.

original: de med na zhes bya bar ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rtags de med na shes pa gang yin pa de yod do zhes gang las yin /üîΩgzhan gyis kyang ni @16b sangs rgyas pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya bar ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rtags de med na shes pa gang yin pa de yod do zhes gang las yin / gzhan gyis kyang ni @16b sangs rgyas pas kyang ngo //
translated: If that is nonexistent, that is, if that sign that is desired is nonexistent, then what is the cognition that exists?üîΩFrom what?

original: khyed la ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: khyed la ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //
translated: For you, the Buddhist,

original: de bzhin du gzhan sangs rgyas pa yang rtogs par byed do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan sangs rgyas pa yang rtogs par byed do zhes 'brel to //
translated: Likewise, the Buddhist also causes the SƒÅ·πÉkhya to understand.

original: ci zhig rtogs par byed snyam na /
analyzed: ci zhig rtogs par byed snyam na /
translated: What does he cause him to understand?

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'di ni khyod grangs can la'o //üîΩde lta na yang sems pa med pa nyid ci ltar 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'di ni khyod grangs can la'o // de lta na yang sems pa med pa nyid ci ltar 'grub snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúThis proof of impermanence and so on is for you, SƒÅ·πÉkhya.‚ÄùüîΩBut how is non-sentience established?

original: ci ltar tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it established by valid cognition?‚Äù

original: nga la ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: nga la ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor me, the Buddhist.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sems pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sems pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnderstanding‚Äù means not being sentient.

original: gzhan yang ni grangs can yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang ni grangs can yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni tshad mas grub pa khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni tshad mas grub pa khas mi len na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if one does not accept establishment by valid cognition.

original: 'on te grangs can gcig bu mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs khyod la grub pa yin no zhes smra'i sangs rgyas pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te grangs can gcig bu mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs khyod la grub pa yin no zhes smra'i sangs rgyas pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if one says that only the SƒÅ·πÉkhya establishes the reason of impermanence and so on, not the Buddhist,

original: bdag gcig pu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gcig pu zhes gsungs so //
translated: then ‚Äúonly for me.‚Äù

original: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is ‚ÄúTherefore.‚Äù

original: de ltar na rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi tshig nyid gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin gyis /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi tshig nyid gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin gyis /
translated: Thus, the statement that is preceded by an inference for one‚Äôs own sake is an inference for another‚Äôs sake.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: It does not exist in any other way.

original: de las zhes bya ba las thal ba sgrub par byed pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba las thal ba sgrub par byed pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the proof of the reductio.

original: gal te de las bsgrub par bya ba nges pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de las bsgrub par bya ba nges pa ma yin na /
translated: If the probandum is not ascertained from that,

original: 'o na thal bar sgrub pa de ci'i don du yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thal bar sgrub pa de ci'i don du yin zhe na /
translated: then for what purpose is the proof of the reductio?

original: 'brel pa de zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'brel pa de zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat connection‚Äù is stated.

original: di ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: di ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub bya med par zhes smos so //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med par zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout the probandum‚Äù is stated.

original: yang thal bar sgrub pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang thal bar sgrub pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is that proof of the reductio?

original: thal bar sgrub pa de ni 'di yin zhes smos so //
analyzed: thal bar sgrub pa de ni 'di yin zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat proof of the reductio is this‚Äù is stated.

original: du ma la yod par khas blangs pa'i cha med pa'i gcig pu gang yin pa de ni yul la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi gong bu gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma la yod par khas blangs pa'i cha med pa'i gcig pu gang yin pa de ni yul la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi gong bu gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: That partless unity that is asserted to exist in many is not a different whole that possesses the distinctions of place and so on.

original: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par du nges pa'i gsal ba gcig pu gang yin pa de dang 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par du nges pa'i gsal ba gcig pu gang yin pa de dang 'dres pa ste /
translated: That which is mixed with that which is a single manifest thing that is ascertained as a particular of place, time, and occasion,

original: 'brel pa gang yin pa des rnam par ma bcad pa'i ste khyad par du ma byas pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa gang yin pa des rnam par ma bcad pa'i ste khyad par du ma byas pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is empty of a nature that is not distinguished, that is, not differentiated, by that connection.

original: thal ba'i sgrub byed gnyis pa brjod ba ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thal ba'i sgrub byed gnyis pa brjod ba ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second proof of the absurd consequence is stated by ‚Äúin the same way.‚Äù

original: yul la sogs pa'i khyad par can gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa'i khyad par can gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not endowed with another that has the particular of place, etc.?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of what?

original: de lta bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i gsal ba gcig dang 'brel pa cha med pa'i spyi gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i gsal ba gcig dang 'brel pa cha med pa'i spyi gcig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a thing‚Äù is a single, partless universal that is related to a single manifest thing that is ascertained.

original: gzhan gang rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa ni gal @17a * //üîΩte zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gang rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa ni gal @17a * //üîΩte zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is empty of another nature‚Äù as being just uncertain is ‚ÄúIf it were.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gzhan dang bral ba yin yang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan dang bral ba yin yang /
translated: Although it is devoid of other natures,

original: gal te yul la sogs pa du ma dang ldan par 'gyur ba de /
analyzed: gal te yul la sogs pa du ma dang ldan par 'gyur ba de /
translated: if it were to possess many objects and so on,

original: de'i tshe 'gal ba ci yod pa de'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa yang yin la yul la sogs pa'i khyad par can gzhan dang yang ldan par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'gal ba ci yod pa de'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa yang yin la yul la sogs pa'i khyad par can gzhan dang yang ldan par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: then what contradiction would there be? Therefore, it is uncertain that it is empty of other natures and also possesses other distinctions of objects and so on.

original: lan ni 'gal ba med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'gal ba med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThere is no noncontradiction.‚Äù

original: 'o na sngon dang phyi ma'i dngos po khyab pa'i dus yod par 'gyur ro zhe na de'i dus su zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na sngon dang phyi ma'i dngos po khyab pa'i dus yod par 'gyur ro zhe na de'i dus su zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if it is said, ‚ÄúThen time that pervades prior and later things would exist,‚Äù the response is ‚ÄúAt that time.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú If‚Äù is from the perspective of others.

original: de bzhin du yul yang med pa'i phyir snga ma la sogs pa'i tha snyad du ci ltar 'gyur zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul yang med pa'i phyir snga ma la sogs pa'i tha snyad du ci ltar 'gyur zhes 'brel te /
translated: ‚Äú Likewise, since objects do not exist, how could there be conventions of prior and so on?‚Äù is the connection.

original: lan ni dus yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni dus yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúAlthough time exists.‚Äù

original: dus tha dad pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because time is different‚Äù is the qualm.

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The establishment of that is as follows.

original: mi la sogs pa'i dngos po gang zhig sngon gyi dus la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ni sngon la sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa'i dngos po gang zhig sngon gyi dus la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ni sngon la sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa yin no //
translated: Whatever things, such as a man, are related to a prior time, etc., are expressed by the words prior, etc.

original: gal te dus kyi dbye bas dngos po rnams kyi snga ma nyid la sogs pa yin na ni dus kyi dbye ba yang dus gzhan las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro snyam na de'i yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te dus kyi dbye bas dngos po rnams kyi snga ma nyid la sogs pa yin na ni dus kyi dbye ba yang dus gzhan las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro snyam na de'i yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: If the prior, etc., of things is due to the division of time, then since the division of time is due to another time, there would be an infinite regress.

original: dus de'i yang sngon dang phyi ma ni yod pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo kho na las yin gyi /
analyzed: dus de'i yang sngon dang phyi ma ni yod pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo kho na las yin gyi /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúIts prior and posterior are indeed existent, but they are due to its own nature alone.

original: dus gzhan tha dad pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan tha dad pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not due to another time that is different.

original: de bzhin du yul yang yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo kho na las shar ba la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul yang yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo kho na las shar ba la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Similarly, a place is also due to its own nature alone.‚Äù

original: lan du 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba ni yul dang dus dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni yul dang dus dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to place and time.

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni lhan cig spyod pa ma la sogs pa'i de bzhin te sngon dang phyi ma yin pa'i phyir yul dang dus dag kyang der 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni lhan cig spyod pa ma la sogs pa'i de bzhin te sngon dang phyi ma yin pa'i phyir yul dang dus dag kyang der 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The objection is that the companion, mother, etc. are like that, since they are prior and subsequent, and so the object and time would be like that.

original: lan du phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚Äúmutually.‚Äù

original: de ltar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni sngon dang phyi mar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni sngon dang phyi mar 'gyur bas so //
translated: ‚Äú Since they would be like that‚Äù means since they would be prior and subsequent.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni dus la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni dus la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Here also‚Äù means in regard to time.

original: ci ltar phan tshun brten par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar phan tshun brten par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How would they be mutually dependent?

original: lhan cig spyod pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The ‚Äúcompanion‚Äù is stated.

original: gcig ni zhes bya ba'i dus sam lhan cig spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni zhes bya ba'i dus sam lhan cig spyod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú One‚Äù is either time or the companion.

original: 'on te dngos po dang dus la sogs pa dag gis snga ma dang phyi ma nyid khas mi len gyi /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po dang dus la sogs pa dag gis snga ma dang phyi ma nyid khas mi len gyi /
translated: But if one does not accept priority and posteriority in terms of things, time, etc.,üîΩbut rather they are only coexistent,

original: 'on kyang lhan cig 'byung ba kho na yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhan cig 'byung ba kho na yin no snyam na /
translated: then what?

original: de'i tshe dngos po dang dus la sogs pa gnyis po @17b dag lhan cig 'byung bar khas len pa yin na ni sngon nyid phan tshun gyi byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po dang dus la sogs pa gnyis po @17b dag lhan cig 'byung bar khas len pa yin na ni sngon nyid phan tshun gyi byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that things and time, etc. arise together, then they would not have been mutually established previously.

original: dang po ni gsal ba nyid bas tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa ni ci srid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni gsal ba nyid bas tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa ni ci srid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The first verse is the summary, and the second verse, ‚ÄúAs long as . . . ,‚Äù is the commentary.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs bsal nas rang gi lugs nye bar sdud pa ni rang bzhin te rang gi rgyus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs bsal nas rang gi lugs nye bar sdud pa ni rang bzhin te rang gi rgyus zhes bya'o //
translated: Having refuted the opponent‚Äôs position, he presents his own position: ‚ÄúThe nature . . . of its cause.‚Äù

original: gal te gzhan gyi dngos po snga ma dang phyi ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dngos po snga ma dang phyi ma nyid yin na /
translated: If the prior and subsequent states are different,

original: de'i tshe rgyu yod pa dang med pa dag nyid las 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu yod pa dang med pa dag nyid las 'gyur mod /
translated: then they would arise from the existence and nonexistence of the cause.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since this is certainly to be accepted, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover . . . ,‚Äù and so on.

original: snga ma 'das pa dang / phyi ma ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba yang rnam par gnas pas te /
analyzed: snga ma 'das pa dang / phyi ma ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba yang rnam par gnas pas te /
translated: The prior state is the past, the subsequent state is the future, and the present state is the present.

original: rnam par gnas pas ni dus med pas kyang grub pas so //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pas ni dus med pas kyang grub pas so //
translated: and by the term ‚Äúenduring‚Äù it is established that it exists even when there is no time.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu yod dang med de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod dang med de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect exists and does not exist.

original: 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba 'di las ni da ltar ba rnam par gnas la /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba 'di las ni da ltar ba rnam par gnas la /
translated: The effect exists means that the present exists.

original: med pa zhes bya ba 'di las ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag go//
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba 'di las ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag go//
translated: The effect does not exist means that the past and future do not exist.

original: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las she na /
translated: Why is it said that the effect exists and does not exist?

original: rgyu yod pa dang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩrgyu yod pa las ni 'bras bu yod pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa dang zhes bya ba ste / rgyu yod pa las ni 'bras bu yod pa yin la /
translated: Because the cause exists and does not exist.üîΩThe effect exists from the cause existing.

original: med pa las ni med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa las ni med pa'o //
translated: The effect does not exist from the cause not existing.

original: dang gi sgras ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig ni gyo mo la sogs pa 'bras bu mi 'dra ba yod pa las med pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig ni gyo mo la sogs pa 'bras bu mi 'dra ba yod pa las med pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù should be understood to mean that some effects, such as potsherds, exist from the cause not existing, that is, from the cause having a different effect.

original: /'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: /'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The effect is twofold.

original: de la gang zhig rgyu'i rgyun la ltos nas gnas pa can de ni rgyu yod pa las yod pa'i da ltar ba yin /
analyzed: de la gang zhig rgyu'i rgyun la ltos nas gnas pa can de ni rgyu yod pa las yod pa'i da ltar ba yin /
translated: That which endures in dependence on the continuum of the cause is the present effect that exists from the cause existing.

original: med pas med pa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / 'das pa 'gags pa yin te /
analyzed: med pas med pa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / 'das pa 'gags pa yin te /
translated: That which is nonexistent because of nonexistence is unarisen future and ceased past.

original: dper na du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the effect of smoke, etc.

original: gang zhig rgyun la mi ltos par gnas pa can de ni rgyu yod pa la yod pa zhes bya ba da ltar ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyun la mi ltos par gnas pa can de ni rgyu yod pa la yod pa zhes bya ba da ltar ba yin la /
translated: That which exists as enduring without depending on a continuum is present, called ‚Äúexistent because of existent cause.‚Äù

original: med pas med pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: med pas med pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: That which is nonexistent because of nonexistence is future.

original: mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yod pa las ni 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yod pa las ni 'das pa yin te /
translated: That which has an effect that is different is past.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the effect of a pot, etc.

original: des na dus med kyang snga ma dang phyi ma nyid ni nyams pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na dus med kyang snga ma dang phyi ma nyid ni nyams pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, although time does not exist, prior and posterior are not impaired.

original: des na ma mthong ba'i dus rtag pa ci zhig bya sngon dang phyi ma dang bar gyi dngos po ni yod pa dang med pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ma mthong ba'i dus rtag pa ci zhig bya sngon dang phyi ma dang bar gyi dngos po ni yod pa dang med pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, what is the use of a permanent time that is not seen? The existence and nonexistence of prior, posterior, and middle things are established.

original: bar gyi ni dngos po ni zhes bya ba'i bar ni 'bras bu yod pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: bar gyi ni dngos po ni zhes bya ba'i bar ni 'bras bu yod pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The middle thing is dependent on the existence of the effect.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma ni 'bras bu med pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma ni 'bras bu med pa la ltos nas so //
translated: The former and latter are in relation to the absence of effect.

original: tshig le'ur @18a * //üîΩbyas par ni phyi ma'i sgras da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa gnyi ga bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig le'ur @18a * // byas par ni phyi ma'i sgras da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa gnyi ga bsdus pa yin no //
translated: In the verse it says:üîΩThe word ‚Äúlatter‚Äù includes both the present and future.

original: 'das pa la ltos na gnyi ga la yang phyi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la ltos na gnyi ga la yang phyi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In relation to the past, both are latter.

original: 'o na ci ltar rgyu snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos por 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rgyu snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos por 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But how can it be the prior and latter cause?

original: rgyu de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of that is also.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If it is said that it is not so, etc.

original: yun ring mor byas so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad la byas so zhes bya ba'i bsnyad pa ni las kyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can yin la /
analyzed: yun ring mor byas so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad la byas so zhes bya ba'i bsnyad pa ni las kyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can yin la /
translated: The expression ‚Äúit is done‚Äù is the reason for the state of action.

original: yun ring mo zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: yun ring mo zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúLong time‚Äù is the reason for the state of substance.

original: des na rdzas kyis dngos po dus yod par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rdzas kyis dngos po dus yod par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, time exists as a substance.

original: gal te yun ring po dang myur ba la sogs pa'i blo'i gzung bar bya ba dus yin par 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te yun ring po dang myur ba la sogs pa'i blo'i gzung bar bya ba dus yin par 'dod na //
translated: If it is asserted that time is the object of the cognition of long and short, etc.,

original: de'i tshe thog ma dang tham med pa'i dus las /
analyzed: de'i tshe thog ma dang tham med pa'i dus las /
translated: At that time, how could there be a cognition of swiftness, etc.

original: ci ltar na myur ba la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar na myur ba la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur /
translated: with respect to a time that is without a beginning and end?

original: thog ma dang tham med pa'i sgras ni rtag pa nyid brjod pa dang khyab pa nyid kyang nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: thog ma dang tham med pa'i sgras ni rtag pa nyid brjod pa dang khyab pa nyid kyang nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The words ‚Äúwithout a beginning and end‚Äù indicate permanence and also suggest pervasion.üîΩTherefore, if the object to be grasped is permanent and pervasive, how could the cognition that grasps it be swift, etc.?

original: des na gzung bar bya brtag pa dang khyab pa yin na 'dzin par byed pa'i blo myur ba la sogs par ci ltar 'jug / de nyid ces bya ba ni dus so //
analyzed: des na gzung bar bya brtag pa dang khyab pa yin na 'dzin par byed pa'i blo myur ba la sogs par ci ltar 'jug / de nyid ces bya ba ni dus so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very‚Äù refers to time.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni khyab pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni khyab pa ma yin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù refers to non-pervasion.

original: de lta bur ma gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur ma gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot like that‚Äù refers to pervasion.

original: 'on te yun ring po la sogs par bzung yang 'di ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te yun ring po la sogs par bzung yang 'di ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: But if it is grasped as long, etc., then it is the very nature of permanence, etc.

original: gzung ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is the nature of the object grasped‚Äù is stated.

original: rang bzhin ni yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature is characterized by long, swift, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gzung ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan pa rtag pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gzung ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan pa rtag pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Otherwise, means other than the nature of what is apprehended, such as permanence, etc.

original: bo na yun ring ba dang myur pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid dus yin no snyam na /
analyzed: bo na yun ring ba dang myur pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid dus yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that time is the nature of long and short, etc.,

original: yun ring zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Long, etc.,

original: thal 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: thal 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The Consequentialists say that long and short, etc., are distinctions.

original: de bas na dus khyab pa dang gcig nyid ci ltar yin /
analyzed: de bas na dus khyab pa dang gcig nyid ci ltar yin /
translated: Therefore, how can time be pervasive and one?

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If, means raising an objection.

original: don 'di dus ni yun ring zhes bya ba'i gnas lugs te /
analyzed: don 'di dus ni yun ring zhes bya ba'i gnas lugs te /
translated: The meaning is that time is long, etc.

original: rnam gzhag 'di rnam par dbye ba las te tha dad pa las yun ring po la sogs pa'i khyad par dus kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni dngos po nyid der 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam gzhag 'di rnam par dbye ba las te tha dad pa las yun ring po la sogs pa'i khyad par dus kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni dngos po nyid der 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: This arrangement is from the analysis, i.e., from the differentiation, of long, etc., which are the nature of time, and which are the distinctions. They are just things.

original: yun ring ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: Long, etc., is explained.

original: de dang ldan pa ni ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and that which possesses it is the cow.

original: lan ni de ltar na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgtan @18b tshigs de'i phyir dus ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan ni de ltar na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o // gtan @18b tshigs de'i phyir dus ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIf that is so, then . . . .‚Äù

original: dus kyi spyi nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus kyi spyi nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that time is not established because there is no universal of time.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dus ni rdzas kyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: dus ni rdzas kyi zhes smos so //
translated: Time is said to be a substance.

original: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is a statement of acceptance.

original: 'di ni de las tha dad par yod pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /üîΩyun ring ba la sogs pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de las tha dad par yod pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni / yun ring ba la sogs pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it does not exist separately from that.üîΩThe response is ‚Äúbecause of long and so on . . . .‚Äù

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni yun ring ba la sogs pa la'o //üîΩ'o na ni yun ring ba la sogs pa nyid dus yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni yun ring ba la sogs pa la'o // 'o na ni yun ring ba la sogs pa nyid dus yin no snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to long and so on.üîΩIf you think that long and so on are time,

original: yun ring zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yun ring zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the response is ‚ÄúLong and so on . . . .‚Äù

original: de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mngon sum med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mngon sum med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist, because they are not directly perceived.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang bya ba rtogs pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang bya ba rtogs pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is connected to the statement ‚ÄúInference also does not comprehend activity.‚Äù

original: tshad gyur las zhes bya ba ni las la gnas pa'i bya ba med par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshad gyur las zhes bya ba ni las la gnas pa'i bya ba med par brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the transformation of the measure‚Äù means that the action is described as not residing in the action.

original: 'gro ba las gzhan zhes bya ba ni byed pa po la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba las gzhan zhes bya ba ni byed pa po la gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the action that is different from going‚Äù means that it resides in the agent.

original: 'o na 'di'i bya bas zhes tha dad pa'i tha snyad du ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di'i bya bas zhes tha dad pa'i tha snyad du ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But how can the expression ‚Äúby the action of this‚Äù be used if it is different?

original: thog med ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: thog med ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The root text declares, ‚Äúdue to beginningless.‚Äù

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang du byas pa'i rgyud kyis na don gyi de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pa nyams par gyur pa'i so so'i skye bo gang yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang du byas pa'i rgyud kyis na don gyi de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pa nyams par gyur pa'i so so'i skye bo gang yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The term refers to ordinary beings who, due to beginningless latent propensities, have a distorted adherence to the reality of objects.

original: 'di ga las she na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is this? The root text states, ‚Äúbecause of this.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba lhas byin las tha mi dad par gyur na de'i tshe skyes bu gzhan dag bya ba dang ldan pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba lhas byin las tha mi dad par gyur na de'i tshe skyes bu gzhan dag bya ba dang ldan pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If Devadatta were not different from his action, then other persons would not possess action.

original: lhas byin gyi rang bzhin ni mchod sbyin gyis yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi rang bzhin ni mchod sbyin gyis yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that the nature of Devadatta is that of Yaj√±adatta.

original: lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag la ni 'gro ba yod pa ra yang yin te /
analyzed: lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag la ni 'gro ba yod pa ra yang yin te /
translated: And Devadatta and Yajnadatta are both going,

original: des na bya ba ni rdzas gzhan kho na'o //
analyzed: des na bya ba ni rdzas gzhan kho na'o //
translated: so the action is a different substance.

original: 'dis bzlog pa tha dad bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis bzlog pa tha dad bar brjod do //
translated: This is the opposite of what you said.

original: rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: As for the statement about concomitance, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚ÄùüîΩsince a person who has a nature and an action is also pervaded by having another action, it is to be considered and established that the action is different, but the person is not different.

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu bya ba dang ldan pa las skyes bu gzhan yang khyab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bya ba gzhan yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brtag ste rnam par gzhag pa yin gyis don dam par ni tha dad par mthong ba yang ma
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu bya ba dang ldan pa las skyes bu gzhan yang khyab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bya ba gzhan yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brtag ste rnam par gzhag pa yin gyis don dam par ni tha dad par mthong ba yang ma
translated: But in reality, even the seeing of difference is notüîΩestablished.

original: yin no // 'di yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad par lhag par zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yin no // 'di yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad par lhag par zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the difference that is stated.

original: bstan zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni smra bar byed pa'i yul zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: bstan zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni smra bar byed pa'i yul zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù means in the passage ‚Äúthe domain of the speaker.‚Äù

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If concomitance and the reverse are not to be understood through perception,üîΩthen how are they to be understood?

original: de ci ltar rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis yul yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis yul yin par brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that it is an object of mere conceptualization?

original: thog ma med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text declares, ‚ÄúBecause of beginningless conditioning.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba la gnas pa rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog @19a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba la gnas pa rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog @19a * //
translated: ‚ÄúConcomitance and nonconcomitance‚Äù means that the activity is engaged in and disengaged from.

original: pa'o ; / yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not exist‚Äù means that it is not engaged in.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the statement of an opponent‚Äôs view.

original: rtags ni mo rtags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtags ni mo rtags la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSigns‚Äù refers to the signs of femininity and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni grangs gzung ngo /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni grangs gzung ngo /
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes number.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bya ba de ltar bya ba med pa des na'o//
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bya ba de ltar bya ba med pa des na'o//
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the absence of such activity‚Äù means because of the absence of activity in that way.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /üîΩci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na / ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is it like?

original: 'di nyid 'grel pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'grel pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúJust like the cognition of a non-existent object.‚ÄùüîΩThe commentary explains this as follows: ‚ÄúJust as the cognition of a non-existent object is not engaged in and disengaged from, so too is the cognition of an existent object.‚Äù

original: de ltar la sogs pa yang zhes ci ltar de ltar 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar la sogs pa yang zhes ci ltar de ltar 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd so on‚Äù refers to ‚Äúin that way,‚Äù ‚Äúin such a way,‚Äù and ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: dus la sogs pa zhes sogs pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i tshig gi don bsdu'o //
analyzed: dus la sogs pa zhes sogs pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i tshig gi don bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include time and so on.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni ci ltar la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du'o //üîΩgal te tshad mas rtogs pa ci ltar gyi 'dod snyam na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni ci ltar la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du'o // gal te tshad mas rtogs pa ci ltar gyi 'dod snyam na /
translated: The reason is as follows: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù is the reason.

original: ma rtogs pa yang zhes bya bas smos so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa yang zhes bya bas smos so //
translated: If one thinks that the reason is not established, he says, ‚ÄúEven though not perceived.‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù refers to ‚Äúhow‚Äù and so on.

original: yun ring ba la sogs pa yang bya ba'i khyad par nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: yun ring ba la sogs pa yang bya ba'i khyad par nyid yin pas so //
translated: Time and so on are also a special kind of action.

original: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of the topic is ‚ÄúTherefore.‚Äù

original: gang gis 'dzin pa med ce na /
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin pa med ce na /
translated: By what is it not apprehended?

original: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By perception.

original: de'i phyir dus khyab pa ni mi 'dzin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus khyab pa ni mi 'dzin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, time is not apprehended as pervasive.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù introduces another opinion.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú No‚Äù is the refutation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde la yang zhes bya ba ste yul khyab pa la yang ngo ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de la yang zhes bya ba ste yul khyab pa la yang ngo ;
translated: Why?

original: / ci ltar mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: / ci ltar mi dmigs she na /
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means in the case of a pervasive object.

original: de'i rten las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rten las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that basis‚Äù is the reason.

original: 'o na ni don gyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i spyi nyid yul la sogs pa tha dad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ni don gyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i spyi nyid yul la sogs pa tha dad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if it is a universal that is engaged in the nature of the object, then it would have the difference of the object, etc.

analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni zhes smos te yul la sogs pa nges pa'i don gyi rjes su zhugs pa ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a nature‚Äù is the one engaged in the object, etc., which is definite.

original: ci'i phyir 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gal zhe na /
translated: Why is it contradictory?

original: der zhes gsungs te yul la sogs pa'i nges pa'i gong bur ro //
analyzed: der zhes gsungs te yul la sogs pa'i nges pa'i gong bur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means in the definite mass of the object, etc.

original: gzhan du yang ni gong bu gzhan du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ni gong bu gzhan du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù means in another mass.

original: de ltar ni khongs su zhugs par ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni khongs su zhugs par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means ‚Äúengaged in.‚Äù

original: gzhan du rjes su 'jug pa la nyes pa brjod pa nyid spyi la tha dad pa med pas gsal ba thams cad der rjes su zhugs par gyur na gong bu gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rjes su 'jug pa la nyes pa brjod pa nyid spyi la tha dad pa med pas gsal ba thams cad der rjes su zhugs par gyur na gong bu gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is engaged in another, then the fault is stated: since the universal is not different, all the particulars would be engaged in it, and so they would be one mass.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rten zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the basis‚Äù is the reason.

original: 'di gnyis so zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis so zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThese two‚Äù is the understanding of the difference.

original: mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same‚Äù means non-different.

original: 'dir brjod pa zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa 'di nyid de blo'am don gyi yin grang /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa 'di nyid de blo'am don gyi yin grang /
translated: Here, ‚Äúit is said‚Äù refers to this similarity, whether of cognition or of object.

original: de la re zhig blo'i ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni @19b gzhan du ni zhes bya ba blo la'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig blo'i ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni @19b gzhan du ni zhes bya ba blo la'o //
translated: First, it is said that it is not of cognition, as stated in ‚Äúin another cognition.‚Äù

original: mtshungs te zhes bya ba ni blo la yod pa'i mtshungs pa nyid des ni gzhan la zhes bya ba don la mtshungs pa yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs te zhes bya ba ni blo la yod pa'i mtshungs pa nyid des ni gzhan la zhes bya ba don la mtshungs pa yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same‚Äù means that the similarity that exists in cognition does not exist in another, i.e., in the object, by that very similarity.

original: phyogs gnyis pa'i dogs pa bsu nas sel ba ni mtshungs rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa'i dogs pa bsu nas sel ba ni mtshungs rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to dispel the doubt of the second party, it is said ‚Äúthe similar,‚Äù etc.

original: don khra bo la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: don khra bo la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In a variegated object, etc.

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don du gzhi 'dings  pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don du gzhi 'dings  pa ni /
translated: The basis for the analysis is stated.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam pa can gyi zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo zhes bya ba'i sgra dang 'brel pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don gang yang yin pa de rnam par dpyad na rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //

analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po nyid ston pa ni brgya zhig la rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po sel ba ni rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: 'dis ni tshig gi le'ur byas pa dang po rnam par bkral lo //

original: snang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is appearance itself‚Äù means

translated: If it is the latter, then how is it that blue, which is different from yellow, is seen as not similar to yellow? In the same way, it would be seen as not similar to another blue.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i blos kyang dngos po gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i blos kyang dngos po gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can 'dzin pa yin no //

original: rang gi lta ba'i phyogs su ltung bas gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'grub na ni de'i 'jig rten mtha' dag mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sgra ni kun la zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: 'di ni blo med de blo gros ngan pa'i blo 'khrugs pa yin no //

analyzed: ci'i phyir gcig ma yin zhe na /

analyzed: de ltar mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: gcig nyid du khas blangs nas kyang nyes pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Having accepted that they are the same, he states the fault:

original: gcig phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig phyir zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: aspect.üîΩEven if one aspect is apprehended,

analyzed: rnam pa gcig bzung na yang zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa bzung na yang ngo //
translated: if the aspect of the universal is apprehended,üîΩit is apprehended,

analyzed: gzung pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mtha' dag la 'du ba'i rnam pa gzung ba nyid do //
translated: that is, the aspect that is included in all the individual things is apprehended.

original: rnam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pas chod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pas chod pa'o //
translated: Endowed with an aspect is obstructed by an object and so on.üîΩFrom that,

analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni bzung bzhin pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa gzhan tha dad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni mdun na 'dug pa'i rnam pa can las rnam pa can gzhan pa'o //

original: gal te mdun na 'dug pa rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa bzung ba na rnam pa dang ldan pa gzhan gyis 'dzin na de'i tshe rnam pa dang ldan pa gzhan la gnas pa'i rnam pa yang ma bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mdun na 'dug pa rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa bzung ba na rnam pa dang ldan pa gzhan gyis 'dzin na de'i tshe rnam pa dang ldan pa gzhan la gnas pa'i rnam pa yang ma bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the aspect of the one in front is apprehended as possessing an aspect, and another possessing an aspect apprehends it, then at that time the aspect that exists in another possessing an aspect would not be apprehended.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other is the aspect of the one in front.

original: gsal ba las gzhan pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa ni gsal ba gzhan la gnas pa yin yang 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba las gzhan pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa ni gsal ba gzhan la gnas pa yin yang 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Even though the aspect that is different from the manifestation exists in another manifestation, it is apprehended.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i bdag nyid kho na las te bzung ba'i rnam pa las rnam pa gzhan tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kho na las te bzung ba'i rnam pa las rnam pa gzhan tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same nature as the apprehended aspect, since the aspect is not different from the aspect that is apprehended.

original: de la bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In that regard, the one that is by itself is

original: rnam pa gzhan gang zhig gsal ba gzhan gyi bdag nyid can yin pa de'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa bzung bzhin pa'i rnam pa gzhan de dang de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni gsal ba gzhan la gnas pa'i rnam pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gang zhig gsal ba gzhan gyi bdag nyid can yin pa de'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa bzung bzhin pa'i rnam pa gzhan de dang de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni gsal ba gzhan la gnas pa'i rnam pa gzhan yin te /
translated: the aspect of another that is the nature of another manifestation. That nature is the other aspect that is apprehended. That aspect that is the same nature as that is the aspect of another that exists in another manifestation.

original: bzung bzhin pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin du brjod pa na /
analyzed: bzung bzhin pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin du brjod pa na /
translated: When the nature of the aspect that is grasped is expressed,

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin par brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin par brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not said that it is not of the nature of that,

original: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid du brjod pa yin no //
