analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni tshad mar nges pa bskyed pa na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven so‚Äù means that even when a verbal valid cognition is generated.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni tshad ma 'di la tshad mar 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni tshad ma 'di la tshad mar 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù means that this verbal valid cognition is accepted as a valid cognition.

original: rang nyid de rang bzhin nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: rang nyid de rang bzhin nyid kyis ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself‚Äù means by its own nature.

original: don la tshig de tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: don la tshig de tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe word is not a valid cognition in regard to the object.‚Äù

original: gal te da ltar yin na tshig tshad ma nyid mi 'dod pa thog tu bab po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da ltar yin na tshig tshad ma nyid mi 'dod pa thog tu bab po zhe na /
translated: If it is a valid cognition, then it is not the case that we do not accept that the word is a valid cognition.

original: gang phyir don 'di zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang phyir don 'di zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause this object‚Äù is stated.

original: sngar zhugs pa 'brel pa 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul 'di la tshig tshad mar grub kyang de la tshad ma ci yang med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sngar zhugs pa 'brel pa 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul 'di la tshig tshad mar grub kyang de la tshad ma ci yang med pa kho na ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis object‚Äù is the object of the valid cognition that apprehends the relation. Although the word is established as a valid cognition in regard to this object, it is not a valid cognition in regard to that object.

original: des na mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that we do not accept that the word is a valid cognition.

original: 'di thams cad ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
translated: All of this is merely stated on the assumption that the word is a valid cognition.

original: da ni de yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni tshad ma yang zhes bya bas so ;
analyzed: da ni de yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni tshad ma yang zhes bya bas so ;
translated: Now, it is not even that, as it is said in the words ‚Äúnor is it valid cognition.‚Äù

original: / gzhan gyis smras pas so //
analyzed: / gzhan gyis smras pas so //
translated: The opponent says,

original: gzhan gyis smras pa ni ci tshig med par yang nges par yin nam ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa ni ci tshig med par yang nges par yin nam ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIs it ascertained without words?‚Äù

original: len ni yin pa nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: len ni yin pa nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúIt is indeed.‚Äù

original: 'on te bden pa'i tshig tshad ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te bden pa'i tshig tshad ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that true words are valid cognition,

original: bden pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is, ‚ÄúTrue and.‚Äù

original: 'on te don la mi 'khrul pa nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: 'on te don la mi 'khrul pa nyid kyis sam /
translated: If you think that it is because of non-deception with regard to the object,

original: gzhan du yang khyad par rtogs @32a * //üîΩpa yod pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan du yang khyad par rtogs @32a * // pa yod pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe difference is understood in other cases as well.‚Äù

original: don la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúThe difference is understood in other cases as well.‚Äù

original: gal te tshig gis khyad par bden pa dang mi bden pa nyid du rtogs par khas len na de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa'i don la tshig de rang gi don gyi rjes dpag kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te tshig gis khyad par bden pa dang mi bden pa nyid du rtogs par khas len na de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa'i don la tshig de rang gi don gyi rjes dpag kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that the difference between true and false words is understood, then at that time, with regard to a hidden object, that word would be an inference of its own object.

original: du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba bzhin no //
translated: It would be like smoke.

original: don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa'i tshig las ni rang nyid don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa'i tshig las ni rang nyid don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no object, it is ascertained that there is no arising, and the word itself realizes its own object.

original: kha cig ni tshig la 'khrul pa spang pa'i don du 'di ltar sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshig la 'khrul pa spang pa'i don du 'di ltar sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Some apply this argument in order to eliminate confusion about the words.

original: gal te du ba la sogs pa 'brel ba'i don la rtogs par khas len na de'i tshe de ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa kho nar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te du ba la sogs pa 'brel ba'i don la rtogs par khas len na de'i tshe de ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa kho nar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi don ni ma yin te /
translated: If one accepts that smoke and so on are related to the object of realization, then it is only an inference for oneself and not for another,

original: rtags las skyes pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don ni tshig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: rtags las skyes pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don ni tshig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar ro //
translated: because it arises from a reason and because the object of another is the nature of words.

original: gal te sgra rnams don dang 'brel ba med na de las ci ltar dran de na tshig la khyad par mthong ba med ces ci ltar brjod snyam na /
analyzed: gal te sgra rnams don dang 'brel ba med na de las ci ltar dran de na tshig la khyad par mthong ba med ces ci ltar brjod snyam na /
translated: If words are not related to the object, how can they be remembered? How can one say that one does not see a difference in the words?

original: dran pa log par 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa log par 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that memory engages erroneously.

original: 'on sngar gyi tshad ma'i rang bzhin nges par 'dzin par byed pa'i tshig ni de la tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on sngar gyi tshad ma'i rang bzhin nges par 'dzin par byed pa'i tshig ni de la tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks, The words that determine the nature of a previous valid cognition are valid cognition with respect to that,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: therefore is said.

original: rtags gang zhig shin tu dpyad pa ste /
analyzed: rtags gang zhig shin tu dpyad pa ste /
translated: That reason is very well analyzed.

original: rtags 'ga' zhig po de las sngar gyi 'brel ba 'dzin pa'i tshad ma bzhin te nges pa ste rnges su mthun pa dran pa yin gyi tshig las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags 'ga' zhig po de las sngar gyi 'brel ba 'dzin pa'i tshad ma bzhin te nges pa ste rnges su mthun pa dran pa yin gyi tshig las ni ma yin no //
translated: From that reason, just like the previous valid cognition that apprehends the relation, there is ascertainment, that is, recollection of the subsequent concordance, but not from the words.

original: des na tshig gi tshad ma la tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tshig gi tshad ma la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, words are not valid cognition.

original: don phyi rol la yang ma yin /
analyzed: don phyi rol la yang ma yin /
translated: Nor is it with respect to external objects.

original: 'bad rtsol la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it with respect to effort.

original: yang 'bad rtsol yang phyi'i don la tshad ma ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar tshig tshad ma ma yin pa des na lkog tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang 'bad rtsol yang phyi'i don la tshad ma ma yin no // gang gi phyir de ltar tshig tshad ma ma yin pa des na lkog tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, effort is also not valid cognition with respect to external objects.üîΩSince in that way words are not valid cognition, therefore it is said, with respect to the hidden...

original: pha rol po rjes su dpag pa'i dus na 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir na 'brel ba nges pa med par brjod pa ni ;
analyzed: pha rol po rjes su dpag pa'i dus na 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir na 'brel ba nges pa med par brjod pa ni ;
translated: Because at the time of inferring the opponent, there is no valid cognition apprehending the relation, the expression without ascertaining the relation is said.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the question.

original: tshad ma des zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: tshad ma des zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that valid cognition‚Äù is the answer.

original: tshad ma las zhes bya ba ni me dud kyi 'brel ba 'dzin pa las so //
analyzed: tshad ma las zhes bya ba ni me dud kyi 'brel ba 'dzin pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom a valid cognition‚Äù means from the apprehension of the connection between smoke and fire.

original: dran pa ni zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan du ril du ba mthong ba las du ba 'di ni thams cad du me dang 'brel pa yin na zhes khyab pa lhag par zhen pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa ni zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan du ril du ba mthong ba las du ba 'di ni thams cad du me dang 'brel pa yin na zhes khyab pa lhag par zhen pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMemory‚Äù is the recollection of the perception of smoke at another time. ‚ÄúThis smoke is connected with fire everywhere‚Äù is the superimposition of the pervasion.

original: rgyud nas skyes pas nye bar btags nas tshad ma ci ltar ma yin /
analyzed: rgyud nas skyes pas nye bar btags nas tshad ma ci ltar ma yin /
translated: Since it arises from a continuum, why is it not a valid cognition, even though it is figuratively designated as such?

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blangs par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blangs par byas pa yin te /
translated: This is something that must be accepted.

original: de ltar ma yin na rjes su dpag pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na rjes su dpag pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no arising of inference.

original: ha cang thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ha cang thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there the fault of overextension.

original: nye bar ma btags na ni gnyis kho na tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: nye bar ma btags na ni gnyis kho na tshad ma yin la /
translated: If it is not figuratively designated, there are only two valid cognitions.

original: nye bar btags pa las ni tshig kyang yin @32b no zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa las ni tshig kyang yin @32b no zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is figuratively designated, there is also verbal valid cognition.

original: de ltar na 'o na dran pa mtha' dag tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na dran pa mtha' dag tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then all memory would be valid cognition.

original: tshang ma yin la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshang ma yin la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúall‚Äù is the universal.

original: de ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dran pa'o //
translated: This is memory.

original: dran pa 'di ni zhes bya ba na nyer 'jog nyid ces bya ba'i rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa 'di ni zhes bya ba na nyer 'jog nyid ces bya ba'i rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis memory‚Äù is the thesis.üîΩ‚ÄúThe sign that apprehends the pervasion‚Äù is the memory that has the nature of ascertaining the pervasion.

original: khyab pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma las ni khyab pa nges pa'i rang bzhin gyi dran pa skya ba yin no zhes tshad ma dang dran pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i tshad ma ni dran pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma las ni khyab pa nges pa'i rang bzhin gyi dran pa skya ba yin no zhes tshad ma dang dran pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i tshad ma ni dran pa kho na yin no //
translated: The valid cognition that apprehends the causal and resultant nature of valid cognition and memory is memory itself.

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i dran pa de yang gzung bar bya ba de gnyis dang 'brel pa ni dran pa gzhan gyis shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i dran pa de yang gzung bar bya ba de gnyis dang 'brel pa ni dran pa gzhan gyis shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: That memory that apprehends also is related to those two objects to be apprehended, and is to be known by another memory.

original: de ltar ma yin par 'brel pa ci ltar 'dzin /üîΩdran pa gnyis pa de yang de dag dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin par 'brel pa ci ltar 'dzin / dran pa gnyis pa de yang de dag dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Otherwise, how could it apprehend the relation?üîΩThat second memory also is related to those two,

original: de'i 'brel pa yang dran pa gzhan gsum la yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa yang dran pa gzhan gsum la yin no //
translated: and its relation is to a third memory.

original: de tshad ma dang dran pa gnyis dang 'brel pa yang dran pa gzhan gyis shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pas dran pa las nges pa skye bar gal 'gyur te /
analyzed: de tshad ma dang dran pa gnyis dang 'brel pa yang dran pa gzhan gyis shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pas dran pa las nges pa skye bar gal 'gyur te /
translated: And if it is related to both valid cognition and memory, it is to be known by another memory, and so on ad infinitum. Therefore, how can certainty arise from memory?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdran pa 'di bstan pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang po nyid dran pa gzhan la mi ltos par 'di /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to // dran pa 'di bstan pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang po nyid dran pa gzhan la mi ltos par 'di /
translated: It cannot, is the meaning.üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is this memory that is taught?‚Äù

original: 'di las byung ba yin no zhes nges par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba yin no zhes nges par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is the first memory, which does not depend on another memory, and it is that which ascertains, ‚ÄúThis arose from that.‚Äù

original: log pa la dran pa bstan pa nyid med dam ci ste med pa la yang dran pa bstan pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: log pa la dran pa bstan pa nyid med dam ci ste med pa la yang dran pa bstan pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But is not the teaching of memory itself false? No, for we see that memory is taught even with respect to what is nonexistent.

original: bstan pa ni don thob pa'i phyir log pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: bstan pa ni don thob pa'i phyir log pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the teaching is not false because it obtains its object,

original: thob pa ni grub pa nyer 'jog nyid do //
analyzed: thob pa ni grub pa nyer 'jog nyid do //
translated: then obtaining is just the positing of what is established.

original: gal te gnod pa med pa la tshad mar ci ste mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa med pa la tshad mar ci ste mi 'dod de /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not accepted that valid cognition is nondeceptive?‚Äù

original: don dam par ni gnyi g-yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: don dam par ni gnyi g-yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: because ultimately both are impossible.

original: tha snyad kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: and also the conventional.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The other is the characteristic of non-defect.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa gnod pa dang bral ba don du gnyer bas tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa tshol ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa gnod pa dang bral ba don du gnyer bas tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa tshol ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: One who is endowed with understanding and who seeks the attainment of freedom from defect does not seek a valid cognition or an invalid cognition,

original: 'on kyang don bya ba'i don du gnyer bas ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang don bya ba'i don du gnyer bas ma yin no //
translated: but rather he seeks the attainment of the object.

original: des na don thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad kho na tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na don thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad kho na tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason for valid cognition is only the conventional which has the characteristic of the attainment of the object, and not anything else.

original: tha snyad las ni zhes bya ba don thob pa'i mtshan nyid las ni ma yin pa'o//
analyzed: tha snyad las ni zhes bya ba don thob pa'i mtshan nyid las ni ma yin pa'o//
translated: From the conventional, not from the attainment of the object.

original: thob pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thob pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In dependence on attainment,

original: thob pa yang dag par rgyun mi 'chad par brten pa las de yongs su bzung ba las so //
analyzed: thob pa yang dag par rgyun mi 'chad par brten pa las de yongs su bzung ba las so //
translated: in dependence on the uninterrupted continuity of attainment, one is possessed of it.

original: don bya ba goms pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don bya ba goms pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the practice of the object, is the meaning.

original: de lta yin mod /
analyzed: de lta yin mod /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: ci nyes snyam na /
analyzed: ci nyes snyam na /
translated: what is the problem?

original: gzhan zhes smos te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes smos te /
translated: The other is mentioned.

original: don bya ba'i shes ba'o //
analyzed: don bya ba'i shes ba'o //
translated: The cognition of the object.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dran pa la'o//
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dran pa la'o//
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means ‚Äúin memory.‚Äù

original: @33a * // don bya ba myong ba dang goms pa des na de nyid bstan par 'byung mod /
analyzed: @33a * // don bya ba myong ba dang goms pa des na de nyid bstan par 'byung mod /
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the experience and practice of the object.

original: dran ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dran ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But memory is not.

original: des na dran pa 'ga' zhig rab nyid las bstan pa yin no zhes ci ltar brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na dran pa 'ga' zhig rab nyid las bstan pa yin no zhes ci ltar brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that memory is taught as the best?

original: 'chad par 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were explained, it would not be so.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o//
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù concludes.

original: des na 'di 'di las byung ba'o zhes dran pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i don thob pas na mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba kho nas tshad ma yin pa'i phyir thug ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'di 'di las byung ba'o zhes dran pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i don thob pas na mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba kho nas tshad ma yin pa'i phyir thug ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, memory is the attainment of the object in that form. Therefore, it is valid cognition only because it is non-deceptive with respect to the desired object. The meaning is that it is not infinite.

original: slob dpon ni phyogs kyi glang po'o //
analyzed: slob dpon ni phyogs kyi glang po'o //
translated: The master is DignƒÅga.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúStated by himself‚Äù means by himself.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos su zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos su zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of inference is taught‚Äù should be seen as ‚Äúin the treatise.‚Äù

original: 'o na don gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na don gang yin snyam na /
translated: Well then, what is the point?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Nevertheless is the point.

original: sgra mi rtag go zhes dang bor dam bca' ba bstan par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag go zhes dang bor dam bca' ba bstan par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: The statement Sound is impermanent is not to be taught at the beginning.

original: de'i phyir na sgra mi rtag go zhes tha mar mjug bsdu bar yang bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sgra mi rtag go zhes tha mar mjug bsdu bar yang bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement Sound is impermanent is not to be taught at the end, as a conclusion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul gnyis pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: tshul gnyis pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o /
translated: It is because of the mere two modes.

original: de la'ang zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi tshig la'ang ngo //üîΩdam bca' ba'i tshig 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de la'ang zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi tshig la'ang ngo // dam bca' ba'i tshig 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: Also refers to the term position.

original: 'on kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs khas len pa la yang gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pa 'di ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs khas len pa la yang gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pa 'di ni mtshungs so //
translated: Not only is the statement of the thesis alone not taught, but also the statement of the reason is not taught in the statement of the counter-position.üîΩThis is similar.

original: des na sgrub par byed pa'i tshig gi cha rnams thug pa med do //
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pa'i tshig gi cha rnams thug pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the parts of the proof statement are not infinite.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'i tshig go //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'i tshig go //
translated: That refers to the statement of the probandum.

original: 'di dag sgrub par byed pa yin yang ci ltar ngag yan lag rnam pa bcur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag sgrub par byed pa yin yang ci ltar ngag yan lag rnam pa bcur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even though these are proofs, how are they ten types of speech?

original: 'di ni 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúhere‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means because the reason is stated.

original: de yang ni mi mthun pa'i tshig kyang dam bca' ba brjod pa de dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: de yang ni mi mthun pa'i tshig kyang dam bca' ba brjod pa de dang lhan cig go //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the statement of the thesis together with the reason.

original: ci de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ci de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú What is that?‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs question.

original: don la zhes bya ba gzhan du bya ba la gnas pa'i don te dgos pa'o //
analyzed: don la zhes bya ba gzhan du bya ba la gnas pa'i don te dgos pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú In fact‚Äù means in reality, that is, in the goal.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äú If‚Äù and so on is the response.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the statement of the thesis.

original: 'o na bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i nang gi yan lag gi nus pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i nang gi yan lag gi nus pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: ‚Äú What is the power of the internal factor that establishes the probandum?‚Äù

original: gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú By which‚Äù is the answer.

original: de la ni tshul gsum la'o ;
analyzed: de la ni tshul gsum la'o ;
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the three modes.

original: / de tshig nyid ces bya ba tshul gsum gyi tshig nyid la to /
analyzed: / de tshig nyid ces bya ba tshul gsum gyi tshig nyid la to /
translated: ‚Äú That statement‚Äù refers to the statement of the three modes.

original: dam bca' ba'i tshig la ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i tshig la ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the statement of the thesis.

original: dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs bstan pa'i gong rol du'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs bstan pa'i gong rol du'o //
translated: ‚Äú First‚Äù means before the reason is stated.

original: de ni bsgrub bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the probandum.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par yang dang por bsgrub bya dgod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par yang dang por bsgrub bya dgod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And in the case of an inference for the sake of another, the thesis is not stated at the beginning.

original: @33b de ltar dam bca' ba brjod pa bsal nas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa bsal ba'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @33b de ltar dam bca' ba brjod pa bsal nas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa bsal ba'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having thus refuted the statement of the thesis, in order to refute the statement of the conclusion, he anticipates an objection: ‚ÄúBut if . . .‚Äù

original: pha rol po zhes bya ba rtogs par bya ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: pha rol po zhes bya ba rtogs par bya ba la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äù refers to the one who is to understand.

original: tshul gsum las zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum pa'i phyogs brjod pa'i 'og rol tu tshul gsum pa'i rtags mthong ba la rtogs pa nye bar skye ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum las zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum pa'i phyogs brjod pa'i 'og rol tu tshul gsum pa'i rtags mthong ba la rtogs pa nye bar skye ba'i tshe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the trimodal mark‚Äù means that after the trimodal mark has been stated, when the understanding arises in the one who sees the trimodal mark.

original: de'i tshe rtogs pa de rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dang khyad par ci yod de ci yang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtogs pa de rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dang khyad par ci yod de ci yang med pa kho na'o //
translated: At that time, what is the difference between that understanding and an inference for one‚Äôs own sake? There is no difference at all.

original: gzhan gyi rtogs pa yang rang la grub pa'i rtags kyis rjes su 'brang ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtogs pa yang rang la grub pa'i rtags kyis rjes su 'brang ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And the understanding of the other also follows from the trimodal mark that is established for himself. This is the meaning.

original: 'o na nye bar gtod pa ni brjod par bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar gtod pa ni brjod par bya'o snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut the application should be stated!‚Äù

original: nye bar gtod pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar gtod pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And the statement ‚Äúit is also a presentation‚Äù is also like that.

original: mthong ba'i nus pa can gyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa de ston pa don du gnyer ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i nus pa can gyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa de ston pa don du gnyer ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the one who is seeking the purpose is the reason that has the ability to show.

original: gtan tshigs gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa la nus pa mthong ba de nyid nye bar bstod pas ston par zad kyis lhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa la nus pa mthong ba de nyid nye bar bstod pas ston par zad kyis lhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason that has the ability to make known the probandum is just what is presented by the statement. There is nothing more.

original: des na gal te dang po bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa skyes na /
analyzed: des na gal te dang po bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa skyes na /
translated: Therefore, if the arising of the understanding of the probandum occurs first,

original: de'i tshe nye bar gtad pas ci bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe nye bar gtad pas ci bya /
translated: then what is the use of the presentation?

original: 'on te ma skyes na de'i tshe nus pa mthong ba'i gtan tshigs yang brjod pa ni nye bar gtod pa'o zhes bya ba nye bar gtod pa'i mtshan nyid nyams so //
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes na de'i tshe nus pa mthong ba'i gtan tshigs yang brjod pa ni nye bar gtod pa'o zhes bya ba nye bar gtod pa'i mtshan nyid nyams so //
translated: But if it does not occur, then the statement of the reason that has the ability to make known is the presentation. Thus the definition of presentation is undermined.

original: des na nus ba mthong ba ston pa tsam lhur len pa'i phyir na nye bar gtod pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nus ba mthong ba ston pa tsam lhur len pa'i phyir na nye bar gtod pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is the mere statement of the reason that has the ability to make known, the presentation is not something that needs to be stated.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang nye bar sdud pa brjod pa ni don med de zhes brjod pa na de de na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang nye bar sdud pa brjod pa ni don med de zhes brjod pa na de de na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression in another way is to be supplied.

original: gtan tshigs de ri la sogs pa'i chos can de na'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ri la sogs pa'i chos can de na'o //
translated: The reason is that it is in that which is the subject, the mountain, etc.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From the property of the position, that is,

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: from the nature of the property of the position, because of being produced, etc.

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ni gzhan gyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ni gzhan gyis brjod pa'o //
translated: The expression a means of valid knowledge up to is not a means of valid knowledge is the opponent's statement.

original: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: The expression what is why, that is,

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma thams cad kyi byed pa 'jug pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma thams cad kyi byed pa 'jug pa des na'o //
translated: why is it that all means of valid knowledge operate in that way?

original: rgyu'i dbang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma thams cad kyi byed pa 'jug pa ni rang gi rgyu'i dngang gis byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma thams cad kyi byed pa 'jug pa ni rang gi rgyu'i dngang gis byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression by the power of the cause is because the operation of all means of valid knowledge arises by the power of their own causes.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dbang gis byed pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dbang gis byed pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: The expression in that way is by the power of the cause.

original: rgal zhing brtag pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni ci ste 'di ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgal zhing brtag pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni ci ste 'di ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression it is to be investigated is why is it so?

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is a philosophical tenet.

original: gal te de ltar tshad mar 'gyur na de bden pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar tshad mar 'gyur na de bden pa zhig na /
translated: If it were to be a valid cognition, that would be true.

original: de ltar ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But it is not like that, is the meaning.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: dam bca' ba ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnye bar 'jal @34a * //
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni zhes bya ba'o // nye bar 'jal @34a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe thesis‚Äù and so on.

original: ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe dispute‚Äù is the approximation.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba nyid phyogs kyi chos nyid khas len du gzhug pa'i don du pha rol la 'dre ba ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba nyid phyogs kyi chos nyid khas len du gzhug pa'i don du pha rol la 'dre ba ni /
translated: The proponent of the philosophical tenet, in order to make the opponent accept the property of the subject, connects it:

original: spyir 'brel pa gzung ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyir 'brel pa gzung ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn general, the apprehension of the connection‚Äù and so on.

original: byas pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan no //üîΩkhyad par gyi rten can de nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: byas pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan no // khyad par gyi rten can de nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBeing produced‚Äù and so on is the response of the other.üîΩ‚ÄúThat which has the particular as its basis‚Äù is the philosophical tenet.

original: nye bar 'jal bar rab tu grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: nye bar 'jal bar rab tu grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa des so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that property of the subject that is well known in the approximation‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'jal ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'jal ba'i yul lo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the object of the approximation.

original: der zhes bya ba ni sgra'i khyad par dang 'brel ba sgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni sgra'i khyad par dang 'brel ba sgrub pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù is the proof that is connected to the particular of the word.

original: sgra dang 'brel ba ni nye bar 'jal ba'i yul yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: sgra dang 'brel ba ni nye bar 'jal ba'i yul yin par 'dod do //
translated: The object of the inference is the sound that is related to the object.

original: de yang brgyud pa'am dngos su rtogs grang na /
analyzed: de yang brgyud pa'am dngos su rtogs grang na /
translated: And is that object understood directly or indirectly?

original: de la re zhig dngos su rtogs na ni mngon sum du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos su rtogs na ni mngon sum du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is understood directly, then it would follow, absurdly, that it is perceived.

original: brgyud nas rtogs na yang de de dang 'brel pa gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: brgyud nas rtogs na yang de de dang 'brel pa gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: If it is understood indirectly, then the object that is related to it must be apprehended.

original: de yang 'ga' zhig tu de mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can kho nas de lta na yang tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'dus pa kho na yin no ;
analyzed: de yang 'ga' zhig tu de mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can kho nas de lta na yang tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'dus pa kho na yin no ;
translated: And that is only so if one has previously seen it. But even if that is so, because it possesses the three modes, it is included within inference.

original: /'on de la tshad ma gnyis 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: /'on de la tshad ma gnyis 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that two valid cognitions are engaged in this process,

original: de'i phyir nye bar 'jal bar smra ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar 'jal bar smra ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then you are a proponent of the theory of the inference of the object.

original: nye bar 'jal ba ni tshad ma'i yul la ni nye bar 'jal bar smra ba rnams kyis kyang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gzhan du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba ni tshad ma'i yul la ni nye bar 'jal bar smra ba rnams kyis kyang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gzhan du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: The proponents of the theory of the inference of the object do not accept that there is another valid cognition called inference.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'jal ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'jal ba'i'o //
translated: The it in the line it is not the object of that refers to the object of the inference.

original: dbyig pa thogs pa'i skyes bu gnyis po de las ma gtogs par dbyig pa can zhes bya ba'i 'dra ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: dbyig pa thogs pa'i skyes bu gnyis po de las ma gtogs par dbyig pa can zhes bya ba'i 'dra ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Apart from the two individuals who hold the sticks, there is not the slightest trace of a stick-bearer.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù refers to the other.

original: gal te de la 'dra ba gzhan med na /
analyzed: gal te de la 'dra ba gzhan med na /
translated: If there is no other trace,

original: de'i tshe 'di 'dra ba'i zhes rtogs pa ci ltar yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di 'dra ba'i zhes rtogs pa ci ltar yin /
translated: then how is there the understanding ‚ÄúThis is like that‚Äù?

original: rtogs pa 'dis ni gong bu tsam las bla na lhag pa'i don la reg pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'dis ni gong bu tsam las bla na lhag pa'i don la reg pa yin te /
translated: This understanding is a contact with an object that is superior to a mere collection.

original: gong bu tsam zhig yin na ni 'di ni khra bo 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi 'di 'dra ba zhes bya bar ma yin no //
analyzed: gong bu tsam zhig yin na ni 'di ni khra bo 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi 'di 'dra ba zhes bya bar ma yin no //
translated: If it were a mere collection, there would be the understanding ‚ÄúThis is variegated‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is a cow,‚Äù but not ‚ÄúThis is like that.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'dra ba'o zhes rtogs pa yang yod pa yin te des na gong bu las lhag pa'i 'dra ba gzhan rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dra ba'o zhes rtogs pa yang yod pa yin te des na gong bu las lhag pa'i 'dra ba gzhan rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But there is the understanding ‚ÄúThis is like that,‚Äù and therefore the trace is understood to be something other than a mere collection.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: That is not so.

original: 'bras bu las rgyu rtogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu las rgyu rtogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The understanding of a cause from an effect is of two kinds:

original: du ba las me bzhin du rgyu dang lhan cig 'bral ba mthong ba las sam /
analyzed: du ba las me bzhin du rgyu dang lhan cig 'bral ba mthong ba las sam /
translated: Just as fire is seen in dependence on smoke, so too the effect is seen in dependence on the cause.

original: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan yod kyang 'bras bu mi skye ba las te /
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan yod kyang 'bras bu mi skye ba las te /
translated: Or, even though another cause that has the capacity to produce the effect exists, the effect does not arise.

original: dper na de'i nyes pa mi skye ba las dbang po bzhin no //üîΩde re zhig dang po sel ba ni gal te @34b zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na de'i nyes pa mi skye ba las dbang po bzhin no // de re zhig dang po sel ba ni gal te @34b zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For example, the sense faculty is not produced from the fault of not being produced.üîΩFirst, refuting that, he says, ‚ÄúIf, in dependence on the cause, the effect is seen, then the cause is inferred from the effect.

original: gal te mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi rgyu dang skad cig 'brel pa mthong ba'i 'bras bu las rgyu rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi rgyu dang skad cig 'brel pa mthong ba'i 'bras bu las rgyu rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If you infer the cause from the effect, the connection between the cause and the effect is seen.

original: de'i tshe 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu yang mthong ba nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu yang mthong ba nyid 'thob bo //
translated: If you infer the cause from the effect, then you would also see the cause that has the characteristic of similarity.

original: dper na du ba las brtag par bya ba'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba las brtag par bya ba'i me bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like inferring fire from smoke.

original: mthong ba yang ma yin te des na ci ltar 'brel ba mthong ba'i 'bras bu las de brtag par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: mthong ba yang ma yin te des na ci ltar 'brel ba mthong ba'i 'bras bu las de brtag par bya ba yin na /
translated: But it is not seen. Therefore, how could you infer the cause from the effect, seeing the connection?

original: mngon sum gyis kyang 'dra ba brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis kyang 'dra ba brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: He says that even though it is seen, it is not inferred by direct perception,üîΩ‚ÄúMoreover,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and also others.üîΩ

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid dam sra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid dam sra ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that very way‚Äù means in the same way or in the manner of solidity.

original: 'o na rnam par rtog pa la ni snang bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par rtog pa la ni snang bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if it appears in conceptual thought, then it must exist.

original: dngos po'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality‚Äù means in the ultimate sense.

original: de lta na yang 'dra ba rnam par 'jog par byed do zhe na rang snang med par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dra ba rnam par 'jog par byed do zhe na rang snang med par bya'o //
translated: But if it is established as the same in that way, then it must appear to nonconceptual consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa ni 'dra ba thogs med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa ni 'dra ba thogs med ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the manner of the nonobstruction of the two‚Äù means in the manner of the nonobstruction of the two conceptual thoughts.

original: yongs brtags na zhes bya ba rnam par dpyad pa na de kho na nyid du rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kyang 'dra ba de la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs brtags na zhes bya ba rnam par dpyad pa na de kho na nyid du rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kyang 'dra ba de la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen examined‚Äù means when analyzed. In reality, no nature whatsoever exists in that sameness.

original: des na 'dra ba ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'dra ba ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, sameness does not exist at all.

original: 'o na ci ltar 'di ni 'dra ba'o zhes rnam par rtog pas mi slu ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar 'di ni 'dra ba'o zhes rnam par rtog pas mi slu ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if it does not exist, how can conceptual thought be nondeceptive with regard to the convention ‚Äúthis is sameness‚Äù?

original: dngos dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the manner of the nonobstruction of the two‚Äù means in the manner of the nonobstruction of the two conceptual thoughts.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dra ba'o snyam pa'i shes pas don bya ba'i byed pa'i dngos po'i tha snyad 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dra ba'o snyam pa'i shes pas don bya ba'i byed pa'i dngos po'i tha snyad 'grub pa yin no //
translated: The convention of the activity of the object is established by the cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is similar.‚Äù

original: gang las she na dngos po don dam pa dang brgyud nas 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las she na dngos po don dam pa dang brgyud nas 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: From what? Because the object is ultimately connected with the continuum.

original: des na 'di ni 'dra ba'o snyam pa'i shes pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa las ni 'dra ba rtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni 'dra ba'o snyam pa'i shes pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa las ni 'dra ba rtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the activity of the object is not performed by the similarity that is established by the cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is similar.‚Äù

original: 'o na 'dra ba'i don bya ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dra ba'i don bya ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the activity of the object is not performed by the similarity, then it is performed by something else.

original: 'dra ba nyid las ni don yang zhes bya ba 'dra ba'i don bya ba byed pa mthong ba med de /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid las ni don yang zhes bya ba 'dra ba'i don bya ba byed pa mthong ba med de /
translated: But the activity of the object is not seen to be performed by similarity itself.

original: ma he la sogs pa las kyang 'o ma la sogs pa'i don bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma he la sogs pa las kyang 'o ma la sogs pa'i don bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The activity of the object, such as the production of milk, is seen to be performed by a cow, a buffalo, and so on.

original: nang khyad ces bya ba ni 'dra ba dang cig shos kyis bskyed pa'i don bya ba dag la'o //
analyzed: nang khyad ces bya ba ni 'dra ba dang cig shos kyis bskyed pa'i don bya ba dag la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù refers to the activity of the object that is produced by the similarity and that which is produced by something else.

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba rnams la yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúthere‚Äù refers to the similarities.

original: 'dra ba nyid las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom similarity‚Äù and so on is explained by ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: des na 'dra ba'i don byed pa las mi slu ba nyid med de 'dra bar brtag pa'i shes pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na 'dra ba'i don byed pa las mi slu ba nyid med de 'dra bar brtag pa'i shes pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no nondeceptiveness in the performance of similar functions, because the cognition of similarity is not ascertained.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means in the case of dissimilar things.

original: ci ltar 'dra ba'i don gzhan bstan pa de bzhin du mi 'dra ba yang brtag dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dra ba'i don gzhan bstan pa de bzhin du mi 'dra ba yang brtag dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as the meaning of similarity is taught, so too must the meaning of dissimilarity be examined.

original: 'dra ba bzhin du ni mi 'dra ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba bzhin du ni mi 'dra ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Dissimilarity is not another‚Äôs assertion, like similarity.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni @35a * //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni @35a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to

original: rtsod pa ni mi 'dra ba de'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa ni mi 'dra ba de'o //
translated: the objection.

original: lan ni 'dra ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'dra ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚Äúsimilarity.‚Äù

original: 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba ni dogs ba ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba ni dogs ba ste /
translated: The doubt is ‚Äúsimilarity.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of things.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù is the response.

original: 'di ni med par dgag pa'i phyogs la brten nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni med par dgag pa'i phyogs la brten nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in reliance on the position of nonimplicative negation.

original: gzhan yang mi 'dra ba med pa gsog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'dra ba yin no zhes bya bar ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi 'dra ba med pa gsog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'dra ba yin no zhes bya bar ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, why wouldn‚Äôt the very nature of a collection that is not different be the same?üîΩBut if the convention of sameness does not occur without difference,

original: 'on te 'dra ba med par 'dra ba'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩmi 'dra ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'dra ba med par 'dra ba'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro zhe na / mi 'dra ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then sameness is not tenable.

original: de zhes bya ba mi 'dra ba med pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba mi 'dra ba med pa tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the mere absence of difference.

original: de nas 'dra ba ni med pa kho na yin pas de'i yul ni 'dra ba yin na zhes ci ltar brjod ;
analyzed: de nas 'dra ba ni med pa kho na yin pas de'i yul ni 'dra ba yin na zhes ci ltar brjod ;
translated: Since sameness does not exist at all, how could it be said that its object is sameness?

original: des na nye bar 'jal ba ni tshad ma ma yin te yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na nye bar 'jal ba ni tshad ma ma yin te yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, analogy is not a means of valid cognition because it has no object.

original: 'di nyid mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the summary: ‚ÄúTherefore, it is not tenable that analogy is a means of valid cognition.‚Äù

original: de ltar dam bca' ba tshad ma yin pa bsal nas da ni lung nyid bsal ba'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dam bca' ba tshad ma yin pa bsal nas da ni lung nyid bsal ba'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having thus refuted the thesis that analogy is a means of valid cognition, now, in order to refute scripture, he raises an objection: ‚ÄúBut if you say that scripture is a means of valid cognition, then it is not the case that all means of valid cognition are refuted.‚Äù

original: dam bcas pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni lung gis rtogs par byas pa'i don ston par byed pa yin na dam bcas pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni lung gis rtogs par byas pa'i don ston par byed pa yin na dam bcas pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is an indicator of the meaning that is to be understood through scripture, then the thesis is pointless.

original: gal te lung gis ma grub na /
analyzed: gal te lung gis ma grub na /
translated: If the meaning of the thesis is not established by scripture,

original: dam bcas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: dam bcas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: what is the point of a thesis?

original: lung nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no scripture.

original: gal te dam bca' ba'i don lung gis grub bas dam bca' ba lung yin na /
analyzed: gal te dam bca' ba'i don lung gis grub bas dam bca' ba lung yin na /
translated: If the meaning of the thesis is established by scripture, and the thesis is scripture,

original: de'i tshe lung med pa'i don tshad mas ci ste mi sgrub ste sgrub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe lung med pa'i don tshad mas ci ste mi sgrub ste sgrub pa kho na'o //
translated: then why would one not establish the meaning of the thesis by means of valid cognition? One would, because there would be no scripture.

original: de'i tshe yang dam bca' ba lung du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dam bca' ba lung du mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the thesis would not be scripture,

original: de'i don lung gis ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don lung gis ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its meaning would not be established by scripture.

original: ci ste yang gal te dam bca' ba'i don lung gis grub pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gal te dam bca' ba'i don lung gis grub pa yin na /
translated: But if the meaning of the thesis is established by scripture,

original: dam bca' ba'i don byed med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don byed med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then the thesis would be pointless.

original: 'on kyang de ni lung gi don nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na lung bcas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni lung gi don nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na lung bcas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it is the meaning of the scripture itself that establishes it.

original: de lung gi don ni dam bcas pa tsam gyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lung gi don ni dam bcas pa tsam gyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the scripture is not established by mere assertion,

original: gtan tshigs nye bar bkod pa don med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nye bar bkod pa don med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the statement of the reason would be pointless.

original: 'on te yang gal te bshad pa'i tshul gyis dam bca' ba nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa de lta na yang shin tu goms pa las dam bca' ba'i tshig dang gtan tshigs de dag nyid de tsam ste /
analyzed: 'on te yang gal te bshad pa'i tshul gyis dam bca' ba nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa de lta na yang shin tu goms pa las dam bca' ba'i tshig dang gtan tshigs de dag nyid de tsam ste /
translated: Moreover, even if the thesis is not necessary in the manner explained, still, because of thorough familiarity, the words of the thesis and the reason are just that,

original: de las gzhan la rtogs pa grub pa yod pa des na dam bca' ba'i tshig ni dgos pa dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan la rtogs pa grub pa yod pa des na dam bca' ba'i tshig ni dgos pa dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and because of that, the words of the thesis are purposeful.

original: lan ni de tshe'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de tshe'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúEven then . . .‚Äù

original: gzhan yang goms pa'i dus de'i tshe dam bca' ba yang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang goms pa'i dus de'i tshe dam bca' ba yang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, at the time of thorough familiarity, the thesis should not be applied.

original: @35b gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos bstan pa nyid las rtogs pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @35b gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos bstan pa nyid las rtogs pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof of the understanding is established from the teaching of the property of the subject alone.

original: sngar brjod pa'i rtsod pa nyid lan btab zin bzhin du lhag pa brjod pa'i don du bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i rtsod pa nyid lan btab zin bzhin du lhag pa brjod pa'i don du bzlog pa ni /
translated: The reversal of the above-mentioned argument is for the purpose of stating what remains, even though the response has already been stated.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase Well then is the reversal.

original: gal te dam bca' ba yang sbyar bar mi bya na 'on ci ltar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dam bca' ba yang sbyar bar mi bya na 'on ci ltar zhes bya'o //
translated: If one should not employ a thesis, then how is it that the master himself said, Because it is produced, it is impermanent?

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
translated: The phrase that very refers to the immediately preceding statement.

original: rtsod pa'i rnam 'grel 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rnam 'grel 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on this very VigrahavyƒÅvartanƒ´ says,

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because it is produced and so forth.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du'o //
translated: The phrase elsewhere refers to the proof itself.

original: de ltar ma yin na bya ba ni sngar gdon mi za bar yod pa ma gtogs par ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na bya ba ni sngar gdon mi za bar yod pa ma gtogs par ro //
translated: Otherwise, the statement the action is prior to the existence of the agent would be meaningless.

original: zur zer zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug pa dag / dbang phyug chen po par thal bas 'jigs nas zug zer la 'khor lo'i sgras rjod par byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas ba yang dam bca' ba sgrub byed du thal ba'i 'jigs pas dam bca' ba la
analyzed: zur zer zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug pa dag / dbang phyug chen po par thal bas 'jigs nas zug zer la 'khor lo'i sgras rjod par byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas ba yang dam bca' ba sgrub byed du thal ba'i 'jigs pas dam bca' ba la
translated: The Vai·π£·πáavas, fearing the consequence of being proponents of ƒ™≈õvara, use the term wheel to refer to the spokes. In the same way, the Buddhists, fearing the consequence of being proponents of a thesis, use the term thesis to refer to the statement of a reason.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu'i sgras brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu'i sgras brjod pa yin no //
translated: The result of valid knowledge is expressed by the word ‚Äúresult.‚Äù

original: de ni dam bcas pa'i tshig gi'o //
analyzed: de ni dam bcas pa'i tshig gi'o //
translated: This is the statement of the thesis.

original: ci zhig brjod zin snyam na /
analyzed: ci zhig brjod zin snyam na /
translated: What was said?

original: the tshom la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: the tshom la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚Äú Doubt, etc.‚Äù

original: /'di la nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa'i don du rnam par rtog par byed pa ni /
analyzed: /'di la nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa'i don du rnam par rtog par byed pa ni /
translated: Another fault in this regard is stated in the verse:

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi sngon rol nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi sngon rol nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means prior to the reason.
